review.title: Old Dirty Sock?
review.reviewText:
Night one, the walls were so thin I could hear my neighbor perfectly. He/She was a little yapper dog that yipped for its owner until very late at night. The last day was the best - an old dirty sock was found in one of the pillow cases...you know, the things we place our face on!
Location was good. Very close to Union Square - right next door to shopping. I was able to walk to AT&T park for the baseball game and I walked down to the Ferry Building (if you don't mind walking around).
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness. Oh, I would loved to see some new gadgets, like a lamp that has the USB plug in. I had to plug my phone in the bathroom.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Nice room, friendly staff, great location, near many restaurants and great shopping.  Close to public transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, bed was comfortable, soft sheets, good pillows!
review.negativeRemarks: Room service would be nice, but you can order food to be delivered>
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do nearby!  shopping, eating etc!

review.title: Not the best experience.
review.reviewText: The water in the shower came at a very slow pace or not at all. The elevator was sketchy. The staff were very helpful and it was clean.

review.title: Right in San Francisico
review.reviewText: It was so nice that it was close to the BART, it's in a very central location. Right next door to a shopping center and can pretty much walk to a lot of different attractions. The building is older and you can tell but it has all the amenities, the room was clean and it was quiet even though it was right in the city. Great stay even though the fire alarm went off at 8:00am and we had to run out, but it was fine. No problems at all!

review.title: Nice Hotel next to Market Street
review.reviewText: I am presently working on Market Street so it is so convenient just to go around the corner to rest. The little restaurant Soma was so convenient right next door for dinner & breakfast!
review.positiveRemarks: The Hotel has that ols style San Francisco feel that I love!
review.locationRemarks: Hertitage Square is 1 block away!

review.title: Nice hotel walking distance to shopping.
review.reviewText: I absolutely loved my stay at Pickwick hotel! They're in house hotel was nice the food was delicious.
Nice location, but I think it is too expensive for its condition. Really nice and helpful staff. Good food
On the 8th floor, there is almost no water pressure for the showers.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to have some infrastructure upgrades.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: shambles
review.reviewText: Upon arrival was asked for card details for any extras however didnt mention would take $50, checked out this hotel mid july and still havrnt received this back yet. Avoid

review.title: Disappointing Stay - Old Building, Horrible Shower
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Pickwick for four nights on a work trip.  We picked it because of its proximity to the Caltrain - which wasn't remarkably close anyway, but the location was okay for SF visitors.

My room was underwhelming in general.  Fine, no outstanding amenities.  The building felt old, and not updated anytime recently.

Day 1 - The mini-fridge had a solid rattle which kept me up at night, needed to unplug it.  My room overlooked the roof of a shorter building which had a noisy air conditioning unit which would wake me up when it restarted.

Day 2 - Woke up to find out there had been a two hour blackout in the hotel, so my digital clock was wrong and could only be corrected by the staff.

Then had an awful shower, which is tough to explain.  It had one knob, off when pointing straight up.  If you turned it to the right, you got cold water.  To the left, hot water.  But no way to get warm water.  It felt like some scenario interview question at Google that I wasn't smart enough to figure out.

I found out that my co-workers had their own special issues with their rooms and various noises.

I complained to the staff, which got my clock fixed, no change to my shower - I spent the rest of my days turning the knob back and forth during showers to avoid freezing and burning.  I'm not quite sure about the fridge, whether it was replaced or not, but it rattled less.

Things were pretty uneventful for the next few days, until I was woken up on my last morning by a fire alarm.  Yay!
review.positiveRemarks: The location was not bad, if you'll be traveling to south to the Valley, but want to stay in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: See my earlier description
review.locationRemarks: You're a short walk up to Market Street and then to Union Square, which are always worth a stroll.  The trolleys are around the corner.

review.title: Cold showers and poor customer service
review.reviewText:
My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for three nights for the last leg of our California vacation. We were happy with the size of our room since it was much larger than we expected, and we also liked the location of the hotel. 
Unfortunately we did not have ANY hot water in our room during our entire stay at the Pickwick. After chilly/windy days touring around the city, this was not an ideal situation to come back to. I let the front desk know, and she said she would let maintenance know. No one followed up with us, and it didn't get fixed. After our second round of ice cold showers the next day, we went back down to the front desk and spoke with a woman who told us that it was going to be looked into and that they had been having problems with their boiler. It wasn't until we asked for the manager to call us directly (since the front desk staff provided us with no help or answers), that we were given an apology. The manager did offer a small reimbursement, but that didn't fix our problem! Our water problem was ice cold our entire stay. Thankfully we were only there three nights.
In addition, after we had been storing items in our fridge, we learned that it hadn't been working.
My husband and I are very flexible and easy going people, but we would not stay at this hotel again. There were too many issues we dealt with during a short stay. We would have much rather spent more money to have stayed at a higher quality hotel where we would have been more comfortable.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time writing this great review about your experience with us and mentioning our staff! We are pleased you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to your return.

Allen Allgood, 
Front Office Manager

review.title: Great Hotel !!      Great location !!  Great Staff
review.reviewText: Will be my choice during my next San Francisco trip.

Booked this hotel at last minute due to a previous booking at another hotel being below standard. Staff were helpful & curteous. Room was clean, tidy. Only criticisms were the room was very noisy due to traffic and location of hotel, hence has to be accepted when booking. The only other criticism was the lack of hot water this was only ever warm never hot and the water had to be run for a long time to achieve any reasonable temperature.
Room was newly renovated, and was very clean, but building is very old and elevator very small. The bed was very comfortable.  Needs some counter space in the bathroom, there was none!
The room smelled bad and had to request a room change.

THERE IS ONLY ONE CHAIR IN THE ROOM AT THE DESK ANOTHER PERSON HAS TO SIT ON BED OR STAND ALL THE TIME, RIDICULOUS!
THERE IS NO CHAIR OR SHELF TO PUT THINGS ON IN THE BATHROOM  THE BATHTUB SHELF IS USELESS WHEN SHOWERING EVERYTHING GETS WET
A FULL LENGTH MIRROR IN THE ROOM WOULD BE HELPFUL
review.positiveRemarks: LOCATION GOOD TO ATTEND CONFERENCE AT MASCONE CENTER NEARBY SHOPPING GOOD FOR ACCOMPANYING PERSONS EASY BUS ACCESS
review.negativeRemarks: PUT A DECENT CHAIR FOR SECOND PERSON IN THE ROOM.  NEEDED FOR READING TYING SHOES WHILE OTHER PERSON USING DESK AND CHAIR - A CHAIR/SHELF IN BATHRM
review.locationRemarks: WESTFIELD MALL/AREA DEPT STORES/CHINATOWN/ART MUSEUMS BY BUS EASY

review.title: 2 Stars
review.reviewText:
Yet remarkably uncomfortable.
No signage indicating where thermostat in room was hidden; heavy traffic, garbage truck and homeless person noise.  Needless to say, not a single restful night during my stay.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Moscone Convention Center.
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, the room was clean, the bathroom was a decent size. They provide Bath & Body works shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion, which I happen to like. The hairdryer was good and powerful, not like most hotel hairdryers. To me, that's important. I was here for a conference, so the close proximity to Moscone was excellent. Plenty to eat and do around the hotel and the Muni F stop is 2 (short) blocks away, as well as the buses, to take you to all the sites in San Francisco. I had dinner my last night in the hotel's Soma Restaurant. I had read that the gnocchi was excellent and they were not wrong. very rich, creamy and cheesy, again, which I happen to like.
review.locationRemarks: The Muni F stop and bus line are nearby to take you wherever you want to go, practically.

review.title: Well-located hotel with all the basics and charm
review.reviewText:
This hotel couldn't be better located.  It's nestled in a corner surrounded by the Westfield center mall, so you'll lack for nothing while you stay here.  It's a good-size lobby with the basics, which is perfect for getting out to your destination quickly.  The rooms are well furnished and the furniture updated in mine, which I appreciated.  It had nice old style windows to open and enjoy the SF 1st summer air, with newer windows fitted on top which I could keep closed to insulate the noise and heat if necessary.

The bed was tremendously comfortable, as were the sheets.  The bathroom was nicely done in old stone (marble?) in a very upscale older pattern.

A few areas like the doors and some trim were visibly older, but everything was well-maintained, and anything that needed updating had been, like the key card entry system and the desk lamps with charging plugs.  There was also in-room AC (that isn't a window unit - those don't count) which, while old, was perfectly serviceable.

Nothing that showed it's age was an inconvenience in any way, and the room still felt nice and clean and modern.

The bathroom was certainly smaller, and was lacking in any sort of counter space, but there was plenty of desk space and mirrors so that made up for it.  I will say it lacked a full-size floor mirror.

Loved the staff, everyone was very friendly and prompt, and I'd happily stay here for the price and location alone.
review.negativeRemarks: The Run of the House room needs a full-size mirror, and could use more counter-space in the bathroom (although I don't think there's a way to add it).
review.locationRemarks: Westfield Mall and food court, breakfast café and late night Japanese/sushi.  Right by Metreon and Yerba Buena gardens, and few blocks to Union Square

review.title: Gross!
review.reviewText: First night, i walked into the bathroom and there was a crusty mens underwear haning from the shower curtain rod. Then I informed the hotel staff and instead of moving me to a better room, they apologized. Then the next night, that same room was making loud noises from the ceiling so they finally moved me to a better room. The hotel as a whole lookes old and run down. Good location, but definately not worth the price!! Don't stay here!!!

review.title: thin walls, small room
review.reviewText: Stayed for a week. It was a slightly more interesting 2-3 star experience. The hotel was ok, the staff was good. I could hear the person in the next room using the toilet, I could easily hear the tv in the room on the other side until late into the night. A homeless person jumped in the elevator, saw I had pressed 5 and said "oh good, my floor", got off with me and asked about the ice machine, then vanished down the stairs when I did not walk to my room, but looked at my phone. I saw a pair of shoes and socks left on the central stairway coming down from the second to the first floor. The elevators stopped intermittently on floors where no buttons were pressed almost every ride. I did not feel in danger or that it was unclean.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was helpful. It was slightly more interesting building/room than a generic modern hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: sound proofing. seriously. everywhere.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, good food nearby. Walked all over the city from this location.

review.title: Business Trip - Great Stay
review.reviewText: The staff was amazing and very helpful. I had asked for a late checkout and the staff extended the checkout for me with no questions. The check in and check out process was very easy and streamlined. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The location of the hotel is great and in a good area.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the location of this hotel. In a nice area of the city and walking distance to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: The shower pressure was a bit low, but the water was hot and the shower was clean.
review.locationRemarks: There are many restaurants and businesses within walking distance.

review.title: Hotel was very old
review.reviewText: Was not very well updated, from the 6th floor you can hear people talking on the streets. Bathroom was ancient and small. Fixtures were at least 50 years old. Poor lighting, outlets that didn't work and a mattress that sounded like you were sleeping on potato chips.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco for a five-day business seminar, and chose the Pickwick for it's reasonable price and proximity to my class location. The staff was friendly, helpful and efficient. There are several courtyards and a Yerba Buena Gardens within a couple of blocks. Westfield Center basically wraps around the hotel, so there is plenty of shopping and a massive food court. There are also nice restaurants just off of the lobby and in the top floor of Westfield. Also check out The View bar, just a block away. Mel's Diner is also just a block away, as are two theater complexes. The hop-on tour bus stops right outside the hotel door. Only a couple of negatives: hot water for the shower would sometimes run out, and for some bizarre reason the huge bathroom didn't have any counter space. Overall, clean and comfortable with lots to do nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, a helpful friendly staff and a nice, reasonably-priced restaurant and bar just off of the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom is large, but there is no counter space. Hot water for the shower was sporadic. I could hear talking and television from the next room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. it shares the block with Westfield Center, so there is lots of shopping and a huge food court. Hop-on tour bus stops right outside.

review.reviewText: staff are good and its comfort  i will recommend this to my friend

review.title: Excellent service and amazing accommodations!
review.reviewText: Beautiful room, view and perfect location right in the heart of SoMa! They even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine because it was our honeymoon!

review.title: No AC and windows wide open
review.reviewText: It was in good location but room was just ok, without any AC in the room, lift was not working, I could hear the traffic from the 4rth floor and the windows won't close. Not worth the money.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.reviewText: It was perfect. Room was not the big, but it was just enough.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly for the most part.  The room was decent, there weren't many frills.  The room was clean and the housekeeping did a good job and cleaning up the room each morning.  Most of the amenities within the room were up to date and made for an overall positive experience.  I found the price of the hotel to be very reasonable considering the location.
review.positiveRemarks: I did not like the snobbish attitude of the bell hop who handled my luggage when I stored it for the afternoon.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattress was I had was not terrible, but could be replaced.

review.reviewText: Horrible bed almost unsleepable my partner like hard beds I like soft beds and we both almost slept o  thr floor as it would have been better than the bed. Ask if late check out was Avilable at 10 pm night before check out and was told would need to ask in the morning. The only thing it has going for it is location

review.title: No hot water in the morning.
review.reviewText: When I reported that there was no hot water (evidently this was the case in the whole hotel), they were not able to give any credit due to the fact that I had booked through expedia.  Also, there was no manager onsite to talk to, I felt horrible for the gal at the front desk who was powerless to help.

review.title: Super over priced and terrible service
review.reviewText: When I booked this room for one night I thought for $700.00 it would be something special. First problem was that I had reserved a king size bed, instead I got a room with 2 full size beds. I'm over 6 feet tall so my feet hung over the edge all night! The hotel said it was the only room available. It was also very noisy because the windows were out of date. The next day I woke up after a terrible night sleep and could not get any hot water from the tub or the sink. I ran it for a long time and tried adjusting the tub valve a million ways but nothing. Now late for my appointment I had to rush out not feeling my best. I would never stay or recommend this hotel to even my worst enemy!
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down and start over.
review.locationRemarks: Shops and convention hall

review.title: If you're a fan of cockroaches, it's the place
review.reviewText: Bad. They had to change my room because we found a cockroach in the room. No room service or minibar, so you have to eat outside and fill fridge on your own. The place is old with small rooms. Moreover, the employees lack costumer service skills. They're not coustumer orientef and don't even have etiquette or smile. These are core skills for hotel staff.

review.title: Weekend prior to Super Bowl 50
review.reviewText: We were very impressed by the hotel itself, the staff's friendliness and helpfulness and the comfort of the room...the bedding is to die for. It's central to everything in the city too: the infamous mall is right next door, Market street is a block away and the we boarded the cable car right across the street to ride to the wharf. Would recommend the Pickwick to anyone!!

review.title: Friendly staff, convenient location
review.reviewText: The concierge personally walked me to the BART station and helped me get a ticket to the airport because I wasn't familiar with the area. He then waited to make sure I went got through okay. I was very impressed and very grateful.

review.title: Great location - tired hotel
review.reviewText:
Had a reservation for 2 nights at The Pickwick to attend the 2016 Specialty Foods Show. Ended up leaving after the first night & relocating to another venue. Originally selected the location given its proximity to the Moscone Convention Center, Union Square, Westfield Shopping Mall, etc.

At first glance the property has pretty decent curb appeal & the lobby entrance was satisfactory. When I arrived I requested an interior room based on noise complaints reflected on various travel websites about street noise. Unfortunately the hotel couldn't accommodate me & I had to settle for a room facing the street.

The bed was super uncomfortable, and the room was extremely noisy. Got rousted multiple times by loud cars, but mostly from loud people, which should provide a great read on how poor the windows really are in mitigating noise. After a poor night's sleep, woke up the next day to find zero hot water, and a literal trickle out of the shower head. Checked out that morning.

Although the Pickwick offers great promise with its location & underlying bones, the ownership group should take a hard look at upgrading its infrastructure on simple items like windows, a decent hot water system, and new mattresses. You know the saying; you can put lipstick on a pig, but at the end of the day......
It is a great location, but also noisy because of that. Otherwise, it is what you would expect from a three star hotel.

review.title: Good and good location
review.reviewText: Great helpful staff. Comfortable room and bed. They had some Internet issues on the third floor but it worked for the most part.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic stay at the Pickwick.  The Hotel is old, but the beds were comfy and room was always very clean.  The lift was a bit slow, we were on the 6th floor so walked down every morning rather than wait for the lift. The staff were very friendly and offered to print maps etc for us. Best part about this hotel was the bar next door.  Happy Hour from 5-8pm EVERYDAY.  The food was great and so cheap and the bar staff were excellent
review.locationRemarks: A little far from the airport, but right next to Westfield for shopping and food, 5 min walk to the cable car and trolley to the wharf

review.title: Very late internet, bad cleaniness
review.reviewText:
Very late internet, bad cleaniness, unkind staff. Terrible fitness center.

Except the location, I will not recommend this hotel to you.

review.title: Our new 'go to' hotel in SF
review.reviewText: From the moment we walked into the lobby the ambiance was warm and friendly. Our rooms were clean and comfortable for our one night stay.  Enjoyed having a drink in the hotel restaurant/bar. The location was excellent. Close to all of our favorite places. We travel to SF about 3 times per year and will definitely make this is our 'go to' hotel from now on. Thank you for a wonderful experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were large and cozy. Warm and inviting atmosphere. We enjoyed the bar downstairs. Calamari was excellent.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and the Metrion, was just a short walk away from the hotel. Do not miss breakfast at Mel's diner around the corner from the Pickwick.

review.title: Business trip to SF
review.reviewText:
Dank, dark smelly and noisy room. 
Pleasant staff.

review.title: Well preserved, historic hotel in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: I'm not sure what everyone on Yelp is complaining about.  I had fantastic service from the hotel, and very courteous staff.  The room had modern appliances but still the original elevator.  And a beautiful view :)

review.title: two night stay
review.reviewText: Bed was too hard and noisy just from rolling over.  The TV channels poor quality as in reception.  The air turning off and on was a loud bang.  Water pressure during shower kept going up and down or the pipes made a groaning sound.    There was a parking garage but it was $60 A NIGHT.  The rooms were small, which had a bigger impact on a big guy like me.  The elevators were half the size of a regular elevator and kept stopping on floors when no one was there.
review.positiveRemarks: location close to where we needed to go during the day.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds, HAVC, TV service provider, offer Continental breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: middle of downtown

review.reviewText:
Pro: clean, pleasant.
Con: lots of street noise, poor sound isolation between rooms.

review.title: Noisey
review.reviewText: You can hear the noise out side and dowstaires very  clearly, especially the bar
review.positiveRemarks: close to the place I visited
review.negativeRemarks: Better insulation

review.reviewText: Stayed at the Pickwick recently for a convention at the Moscone Center.
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to the Mascone center
review.negativeRemarks: Significant investment is needed to refresh the property. The lobby is clean but starting at the elevator it gets dirty quickly.

review.reviewText: Hotel needs to be updated and overhauled.  Staff not the most attentive.

review.title: Great Location close to Market Street
review.reviewText: Good clean room. Quite small though and expensive for what you get (but on the cheaper side for central San Francisco). Staff very friendly and helpful. Free internet was fast enough to stream Netflix.
review.negativeRemarks: It is looking pretty tired and in need of updating.
review.locationRemarks: Central and close to Powell for the cable cars, Union Square five minutes, Market Street and shopping.

review.title: Smoky room, dirty sheets, body hair in bath tub
review.reviewText:
I had a awful experience at the Pickwick. The hotel itself is a faded shadow of its once stately grandeur. Cracked plaster, layers of chipped paint, old hardware, funky smells, and rickety pipes make it feel run down, not vintage. 

The air in my room with thick with the smell fresh cigarette smoke on top of the stale musty air. The duvet on the bed was stained, dirty, and full of someone else's hair. The hotel could not accommodate my request to change rooms because they were full and then refused to allow me to check out and get my money back. The delivered a fresh duvet (which was also stained, by the way) but did not make the bed. Instead, the handed me the bedding and left. Upon entering the bathroom to brush my teeth, I found someone else's private body hair in the tub. 

Good hotels do three things at a minimum -- provide clean beds, clean rooms, and friendly service.  The Pickwick did  none of these.
review.negativeRemarks: Fresh renovation is a must, and delegate authority to staff on site so that customer service issues can be handled in the absence of a manager present

review.title: Close to everything but not very good..
review.reviewText: First of I'd like to state that they charged me a hold deposit fee on day one of almost 400$ without warning! This was to be returned IF I didn't use it??? I've stayed in a lot of hotels before and never had that happen to me till this place. The room was small but looked nice. No more then 2 people would have fit for sure. The bed was okay but felt cheap. Overall it had the standard things one would expect in a nice hotel. The mini fridge was barely working but kept items "cool". The AC was oddly turned off in the room and I had to switch it on when I got in. (It was hot outside!) The only real room complaint is that the shower was impossible to use without issues. It would sometimes not heat up at all. Sometimes the pressure would be only a trickle and others spewing out like crazy! I've morning after just 5 minutes the water just stopped... Had to wait a few minutes just to get it to turn on again.

The location of the hotel was great but the hotel itself felt tired and run down. For the price paid I would have expected a little higher quality. My wall had a patch on it from where a painting had been, the lobby restroom handle was falling off. Just lots of little things.

On the positive side, the hotel is a block from the BART, UNION Square and not far from the water. The staff were also very plesant. If $300 per night is the new $150 rate then this place is perfect.

review.title: Close to just about anything
review.reviewText: Walking distance to just about anything. The BART station is close as well, so traveling the Bay Area is easy. Bathroom was a little small for what we expected, but overall had a great experience and the staff was very friendly.

review.title: hip (but aged) and central, but not wonderful
review.reviewText:
Fantastic location, especially if you are going to the Moscone Center.

On the other hand, it's dark, a little dingy and although it is totally capable of being turned into an "Ace Hotel NYC" space, it hasn't had the renovations, etc to make it a possibility.

My room had a broken AC that leaked on the floor - when I complained, they sent someone to 'fix it' but there was no offer to move me out of a room with a wet carpet.
review.negativeRemarks: needs complete facelift, better service
review.locationRemarks: Moscone Center

review.title: Good hotel , close to everything
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel.Rooms were very nice. Lots of public transportation close. Only downside, sheets didn't fit the king sized bed well and they had holes in them. The Soma Restaurant and bar is worth staying at the Pickwick again!! Food is outrageously good!! Staff at the hotel is top notch!!!

review.title: Nice hotel close to the downtown
review.reviewText: Good location and very good service. Recommended..
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is clase to everything and Italia has very good locomotion

review.title: Decent hotel, with very poor renovations
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel during a conference so prices may have been slightly higher based on the demand for hotel, but expected slightly more from a hotel of this price.  The hotel seemed decent and old but all renovations done seemed to do more harm than good, the door knobs had been painted over with it chipping off, the light covers half painted over, chunks of tile missing around bathroom fixtures since they seem didn't know how to cut tile.
review.positiveRemarks: the staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and did have everything you really need from a basic hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: renovations done more professionally, and more renovations done as the place was falling apart in places.
review.locationRemarks: this hotel was about 2 blocks from the convention center, cable cars and the mall, the location was awesome and could not be better.

review.title: Nice hotel in middle of San Fran
review.reviewText: Clean hotel. Only bad points were a little crack in paint in cieling, bathroom fan was really dirty and walls are a little thin if people are yelling. Other than that very comfortable and cozy surrounded by a lot. Quick to highway. Would stay again no problem.

review.title: I would rate this hotel as a 2 vs a 3 star hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel has tried to renovate but the rooms still have a shabbiness to them as does the hall.   There is no water in the room or refrigerator and there is also no room service.  If you don't have room service, you could at least provide one or two bottles of water.  I paid over $300.00 per night and would have expected more if the hotel is charging those rates.
review.negativeRemarks: Repaint hallways, improve cleanliness, provide more amenities such as bottled water.

review.title: Excellent location! Close to shopping. Union squar
review.reviewText: Great accomodations. Just wish the rooms were bigger. Excellent views. Great atmosphere. Helpful staff. New beds

review.title: Amazing Location! Poor condition.
review.reviewText:
If you plan on spending most of your time outdoors then it's ok. 
Old bulding not remodeled like the others sorrounding it, so yes small rooms expected. 
However, did not expect the bad smell. That was unpleasant everytime i walked in. Staff could of been much friendlier. Any question I had about the area felt like inconvenience to them. 
Maybe if it was cheaper I wouldn't of been surprised at the negatives.

review.title: Not what I'd expect at the price.
review.reviewText:
Poor paint job. Needs repainting.

Elevators were awful and run down.

Towels were old and dingy.

Corners were cut just about everywhere on improvements.  I've stayed in nicer Holiday Inns.

review.title: The hotel is located in an excellent zone.
review.reviewText: Hotel conditions are dissappointing.  Fortunelly it is located close to everything!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel looks very old,
review.locationRemarks: The best of this hotel is the location

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: Block away from all forms of transportation. 20 minute walk to AT&T park.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel - Old but clean.  Noisy (could hear the shower in the other bathroom).
Well located.
review.negativeRemarks: Could do some rooms renovations ie make the walls thicker.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square - perfect for shopping.

review.title: Needing maintenance
review.reviewText:
Initially we were booked in to a room facing the street with downtown street noise. It was a very small room, clean, but needing maintenance.  Upon requesting a room away from the street they did take care of us with a larger room on opposite side of building. It needed maintenance as well.  

I was disappointed in the overall outdated condition of the hotel.

On the positive, the location is in the heart of the city and within walking distance to many stores as well as AT&T Park.  Also the restaurant/bar on location was pleasant with great service.

Note: parking is $40 per night additional fee!

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: We were on the 6th floor so it was quiet and the beds are very comfortable. The hotel is near Market Street, Union Square, and just underneath is the Bart and the underground mall.

review.title: Nice Choice
review.reviewText:
Overall, I found the room clean, comfortable, surprisingly quiet given the location of the hotel, and stocked with quality toiletries. 

Other observations:
Rooms are smallish, but I have a feeling all rooms in this area are smallish.

WIFI was fairly slow, which was problematic because this was a business trip. 

Parking is across the street for $36/day. 

Location seems to be near the edge of where awesome meets sketchy, but everything I wanted to do was within walking distance: 2 play houses, shopping, restaurants, & work. (Work would be need vs. want).

Didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, but the menu looked decent.

Cute "old building feel" to the hotel, while still being up to date and well cared for.

review.title: The stay at Pickwick was a comfortable experiencee
review.reviewText: The stay at this hotel was pretty much comfortable. Though the drawback was no fooding available in spite the cost paid..the WiFi is good..rooms are clean..but no good view even if on d top floors.

review.title: No Free breakfast for Expedia guests
review.reviewText: Big sign advertising free breakfast but when I called downstairs to confirm, she said it wasn't available to guests who register through a "third party." Why should that matter?

review.title: For a 250-300 USD/night this place blows
review.reviewText:
For our last night in SF we decided to splurge a little and get a nice place to get some much needed rest.
The hotel is a heritage building in one of the busiest areas of downtown SF. It looks great from the outside and the location is key. However, the rooms inside are just barely passable for 3 stars. The room interior is just a collage of upgrades spanning the past 50 years, with some stuff looking like it belongs in a homeless shelter.
In the morning I was unpleasantly surprised when the toilet lever squirted a handful of water directly into my face as I was pressing it after finishing my business.
One thing was certainly good - The sheets were white and generally the pace was superficially clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Incredibly old, spotted and oily carpets in the corridors and suits.
review.locationRemarks: Check out the Kombu restaurant on the 4th floor of The Four Seasons Hotel (747 Market St)

review.title: Choose if location is your only priority.
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel only because of location. Stuff was helpful. You can clearly hear people talking in the next rooms and the street traffic. Old building.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel feels outdated. It is too noisy in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping center, restaurants, Moscone West were located literally in a 3 minute walk. Transportation was great too.

review.title: Good location to downtown experience
review.reviewText:
The hotel is nice overall, but is not recently built. The room I got is enough in size to feel comfortable, the bed was also good supporting in question of hardness. There was a complimentary coffee and water in the room. You also have a fridge for your own stuff. 
That I disliked is the windows are not closing out the noise from the street, so I had to wear earplugs to have a restful sleep. I got used to absolute quiet at my home.
The most annoying thing was the wifi, that you can connect to but the speed is completly dead. It took me almost an hour to send a 40k email from my laptop. No chance for viber or skype, so it was expensive to call home on a cellular instead. The sound insulation between rooms is also very weak, you can understand guests talking in the neighbouring rooms.
If you do not spend many time in the hotel it is ok for a short time stay due to walking distance close location to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks:
noise level overall is high from the street and other rooms
WiFi speed unacceptably low
review.locationRemarks:
Union square in walking distance
shopping mall in neighbourhood
cable car very close

review.title: Great location and friendly staff
review.reviewText:
Great location overall as it is very close to Union Square etc

Nice staff 

Rooms are pretty small but hey how much time are you going to spend in room while in San Fran?

Some reason they had maitresses laying around near the elevators (3rd floor)...kind of tacky

Good value and comfortable stay

review.title: One night at the Pickwick hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotels in San Francisco are expensive. We picked this hotel, because of the location. Close to center of town and within walking distance of AT&T park. We had tickets to the Giants game, so it was easy to walk.

review.title: Would not be my first pick.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great location.
The staff looked very disinterested on arrival and were not to helpful. The hotel looked like they had attempted to give it a face lift on t $2 budget and it showed.
We noticed on the first night after a spending 18hrs on the road that you could hear everything going on in the next room and throughout the hotel. 
Road and street noise is to be expected being in the inner city but this was too much.
The two windows in the room had broken locks on them so they were not secure. Their was access from the building next door meaning anyone if they wanted, could get into our room.
I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking to stay anymore than one night.
review.negativeRemarks:
Staff could change their attitude.
Sound proof the rooms a lot better.

review.title: Nice hotel, downtown, close restaurants
review.reviewText: 3 days stay mid May for a business conference nearby
review.positiveRemarks: the cafe restaurant was great in the evenings ; the hotel is well placed in town
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast was too long and average service ; noisy environment for sure
review.locationRemarks: very good restaurant nearby walking distance, great Irish pub too 2 blocks away

review.title: Hotel downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Good location at walking distance to downtown Union Square and Moscone center. The rooms on the street side are very noisy from the constant high traffic throughout the night. In addition, noise isolation between rooms is real bad and you can hear all  next room conversation !

Wifi connection is very weak and at can barely be connected only in one area of the room, of course not at the working table. Do not expect to do any work or even consult the Internet since once connected, the speed is extremely slow due to errors coming from the weak connection.

The staff people are nice and do their best to help.
review.positiveRemarks:
Very noisy: noises from the high traffic streets and noises from next rooms' guests.
Wifi connection is very weak, and connection extremely slow
review.negativeRemarks: Noise isolation and better wifi coverage for business work
review.locationRemarks: Close to downtown and Moscone center, lots of homeless people around

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Is in a good location but however hotel service is poor.  They stuck us in a tiny corner room where traffic noise was loud.  Overpriced!

review.title: Antique Hotel in the Middle of Busy San Francisco
review.reviewText: Coming to San Francisco to attend a conference at the Moscone Center, which is just a couple of blocks down, The Pickwick Hotel looks very unassuming from the outside. Yet, when I entered the lobby and subsequently the room they allocated to me, I was pleasantly surprised beyond a doubt. The room was very tidy, luxurious even in its slightly older modern style. It was well furnished with a good bed, working desks and even a Keurig Coffee machine (that could also serve as a hot water boiler) and even had complimentary WiFi (which is unparalleled to me, as I still needed to work during my stay). The staff were very courteous, giving me directions to places around California via the public transport systems like the MUNI, BART and Caltrain. Housekeeping did an excellent job helping to tidy the room promptly everyday, and as such I was happy to leave small tips every day. If I need to come back for another conference or just to get a place in San Francisco that was in the more busier parts of town, this would be my hotel to be.
review.positiveRemarks: Extremely tidy, awesome staff, great housekeeping and really advantageous location to many town centers, and a short 10-15 minutes drive from SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: The water pressure in the bathroom could be better, but then again it's an old building so I learned to take showers when the system was off-peak.
review.locationRemarks: Extremely near the Moscone Center, Powell BART station, and SF Caltrain station, and even the SF cable car, which makes for very convenient travel.

review.title: Pickwick hotel San Fran
review.reviewText: Spent a month travelling around California with friends and had pre-booked some places and just randomly rocked up to others including hostels and motels. We pre booked pickwick as we were spending 5 days in the city. At first we thought good choice with the hotel based on looks when we arrived but soon after we realised it wasn't great. Rooms were very noisy from both thin walls and doors to adjoining rooms and the noise of the Main Street which runs along the front of the building. The wifi was terrible and very unreliable. We got Phonecalls to our room at 3am from reception and again at 8am....which were mistakes which happened 3 times. Do not disturb signs weren't read by cleaning staff who walked in early morning regardless. Most likely wouldn't stay here again. If I were going to San Fran again (which I will cause it was amazing) I would stay fishermans wharf, north beach areas instead.

review.title: Nice hotel, kind of small.
review.reviewText: The room was super comfortable and everything smelled and looked super clean!   The staff was great and the hotel location is walking minutes from market street.  The ONLY drawback for us was that the room and bathroom were sort of small.  There was not really any space for our toiletries in the bathroom.  Other than that, excellent room!  We will stay here again and recommend to anyone!!  ☺️☺️
Felt very out dated and in need of repair. There was no sound buffering from the room next to me or the street. On the plus side the staff was nice and helpful.

review.title: Wonderful, Cozy hotel
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco on business and needed a hotel for 2 nights.  I happened upon the Pickwick Hotel and booked it because it was close to the location and not as expensive as others in the area.  I was extremely pleased with the hotel and will stay here again for business and pleasure.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the decor, charm and history of the hotel.  Several seating areas to enjoy and the attached restaurant was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: More hot water and more reliable wi-fi (I used my cell hotspot some and it worked great).
review.locationRemarks: The location is wonderful and very close to shopping, tours, business area etc. I was able to walk to Union Square and enjoy a bus tour.

review.title: Great location in SOMA
review.reviewText: The room was spacious and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great close to convention centers, museums, Market street and the mall. Quick hop on public transportation to the ferry building.

review.reviewText: Given the size of some of the rooms we have stayed at in this area of San Francisco, I was pleasantly surprised.
review.positiveRemarks: Really like that the garage was accessed via the basement of the hotel, no need to go outside and the elevator dropped you right into garage.

review.title: Location is its best quality
review.reviewText: I was looking for an affordable hotel in downtown San Francisco. The Pickwick is in a great location but that's its best attribute. Otherwise I found the hotel to be a little run down with the bathroom sink a cracked and other similar signs of neglect. Our room overlooked 5th street and the noise level was louder than I would have liked, late into the evening.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great. It's a one block walk to the Bart, a great mall and the cable car turnaround.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproof windows and some much needed updating to the rooms would greatly increase the overall experience.
review.locationRemarks: The Westfield mall is great, as is the Yerba Buena Gardens.

review.title: Maintenance
review.reviewText: Too old. Not well kept. Need new sheets and an overall makeover.  Slow internet and when asked, clerk said too many people where using it (at 2 am?)

review.title: Well-Located Gem
review.reviewText: This hotel is within an easy walk of Bart, cable cars, shopping, China Town and more. Our room was small but well appointed and the staff was super helpful. We had problems getting online, which would have been a problem if we were traveling for business. But we weren't, so we took it as a sign to get off our computers and RELAX!

review.title: close to Moscone center
review.reviewText: manager and evening staff and bell staff all wonderful.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Great location for attendees to the Moscone convention center. Hotel ok but not great. Internet connection was sub par.
Staff were awesome! Loved ut. Location near BART was great

review.title: Great location. Hardly any hot water.
review.reviewText: Location is great for conference visitors, but the shower often produced water no hotter than luke warm.  An older building, and definitely showing some wear.
review.negativeRemarks: Hardly any hot water, and lots of wear + tear.

review.reviewText:
Staff was courteous, genuinely helpful and pleasant.
I didn't have a couple of small items for shaving and toothpaste and they provided me with them. 

Facilities were clean but overall structure seemed a bit old. (Not sure if this was a stylistic choice)

Internet was just about non-existent so I had a hard time getting any work done in the hotel.

review.title: Too Noisy To Sleep
review.reviewText: Our first room was on the front side and could not sleep for the noise. The room was very tiny also. The second room was on the back and much quieter and larger and nicer but pluming noises and loading dock will get you early around five or six.
review.positiveRemarks: Very old hotel nicely updated. Well kept foyer and halls. Morning coffee at the restaurant was overpriced.
review.negativeRemarks: A lot of improvements have been made.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Near shopping, restaurants, Union Square, China Town and really excellent public transit.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We spent only one night in hotel. The hotel location is very good. It's close to the Powell street cable car and Westfield shopping center. Union square is also not far. The staff were pleasant. The room was clean and comfortable, but a bit small and the bathroom was also small. We got the room at about a 30% discount and it was worth it, but I don't think it's worth it's full price.
review.negativeRemarks: Finish the repairs and painting in the hallway. The bathroom faucet fixtures were also coming apart.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Westfield shopping center.  The cable cars are near and fun to ride. The cable car museum is not too far is free and worth a visit.

review.title: Old Hotel but Great Location
review.reviewText: We had a flight cancellation and had to find a room in town with short notice.  We were able to get a room booked at the Pickwick that day but when we got in to the room we quickly noted that the room/hotel was very old and badly in need of renovations and updates to available amenities.  The bathroom was extremely small with a bathtub in the corner with the coating in the bottom peeled off and the room was roughly painted with the original windows being covered with new ones but that were not sealed or installed properly.  On the other side, the staff was very nice and the location was close to the Westfield Center and other great spots in the surrounding area.  This hotel needs a lot of TLC before I could even begin to consider referring it to friends, family or returning again for another stay.
review.negativeRemarks: The interior of the hotel needs a complete renovation and some areas around the hotel harbored panhandlers and people sleeping on the sidewalks nearby
review.locationRemarks: Westfield Center for shopping, several great restaurants in the area

review.reviewText: I enjoyed the room, but as soon as you walked out the hotel door it was just not nice.

review.title: Centrally located not luxury but nice!
review.reviewText: Staff was accommodating, room was clean.  Definitely a historic hotel.  Street noise to be expected staying on 5th and mission.  Adjacent room noise can be heard through the antique wood doors connecting rooms.  Bed comfortable, bathroom small but adequate.  Overall nice experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Insulations between rooms/shared doors.  Larger bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: Your in the heart of downtown San Francisco the sky is the limit!

review.title: Nice older hotel.
review.reviewText: Nice older hotel. Not far from Union Square. Hotel is going through some renovations but this doesn't affect the overall experience. Staff was helpful.

review.title: convenient location - good value during convention
review.reviewText: The check-in was fine, and I got a quieter room on an upper floor.
review.negativeRemarks: They sound-proofed the windows, but noise from the hallway and adjacent rooms was still above comfortable levels.
review.locationRemarks: Easy location for BART, Muni, F-trolley, or the cable car.

review.title: Decent hotel -  very  close to  convention center
review.reviewText: Hotel is OK. Insist on a room  off the main street.  Rooms are small  but OK. Restaurant next door is just  OK.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: It was great hotel and overall close to all the clubs and close to market street

review.title: Big beds but small bathroom
review.reviewText: In general the room is quiet and comfortable. The beds are big and there is even a closet for clothes.  There is a coffee machine, an alarm which we can use as a speaker to play music. The only thing we didn't like is the bathroom. It is way too small especially the shower area.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the wide beds and the artistic decorations in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom is too small.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great and it is right next to Westfield shopping mall. It is only few blocks from Union Square. Only few minutes walk from bus stops.

review.title: Great location but property is a bit out-dated
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the location in the heart of San Francisco, overall a good deal. The rooms looked ok, but fixtures and beds seemed worn, they probably need new mattresses. Also there was some loud sounds in the morning, that sounded like the HVAC system. Not a big deal, but it might bother some people. Overall I would still stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs updating
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping, nightlife

review.title: "I'll stick with Pickwick..."
review.reviewText: Great room! Very clean and tidy. Built for two. Bed was a bit hard but everything else outweighed that. Convenient location. Across from parking structure. The Staff was great. The old style atmosphere was reminiscent of an era gone by. The Bar & Grill adjacent the lobby was excellent:opens at 6 a.m. closes late. I have stayed in other Hotels in San Francisco for more and got less for the price. I'll stick with Pickwick from now on!
review.negativeRemarks: Mattresses could be softer.
review.locationRemarks: Located in the Heart of Downtown San Francisco. Union Square bustling with excited tourists and things to do and see.

review.title: Old-Fashioned Hotel across from the old U.S. Mint
review.reviewText:
Booked through Expedia.  Check in a breeze.  Needed to switch rooms and got a top floor corner room with a view (725).  This Hotel has old-fashioned open-out (swing) windows and many no longer can be fully closed and/or locked.  The rooms do have noise-reducing inside windows that lock, but the configuration makes it difficult to open/close the outer windows on both sides.  I was not too bothered by the street/city noise.  I slept well.   With a corner room, the bathroom was bright with a wall of frosted glass.  Shower had instant hot water and was refreshing (old iron tub, tiled floors).

The restaurant/bar was very good.  I ate dinner there both nights.  Burger was good but undercooked (mine was the last order, at 10 pm).  They serve American and Mediterranean food, as well as pizza (which the guy sitting near me said was very good ... he ordered a second one to go).  I had the Mezze plate -- falafel, spanakopita, hummus, dolmas, pita -- all very tasty.  I would definitely order it again.  And the extended-hours (3-8) Happy Hour $3 Trumer Pils (Berkeley) beers went great with my dinner.

Conveniently close to Powell  Street BART/Muni station, Westfield shopping  mall (Bloomingdale’s  gives out-of-towners a 10% discount -- Corey in Handbags helped me find the perfect navy bag), Yerba Buena Gardens, Marriott, and Moscone.  Less than six blocks to Union Square. 

Would I stay here again?  Yes, if the price was right.  With two major conventions in town, I paid $960 with taxes
review.positiveRemarks: Perfect location, friendly service, very good restaurant/bar
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the old windows don't close all the way, but they are charming!
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel is centrally located if you need to be in the 5th/Market to 3rd/Howard corridor.  Conveniently close to Powell Street BART & Muni stations

review.title: Great location to everything, verynicehotel
review.reviewText: We had a great time staying at your hotel Mahalo and ALOHA...
review.positiveRemarks: Everything was so close to get to very. convinient to get to places...
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing at all everything was just fine thank you from the owner of RAINBOW SPECIALTY ORG. CO.
review.locationRemarks: Your location is was just fantastic. Everything was all around us. Shopping, dining, parking it was great...

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I was there for the week of Thanksgiving and to attend the auto show. The location was so very convenient I could walk to everything. The Moscone Center, Westfield Shopping Center, movie theater, and plenty of great restaurants all within blocks. The staff was prompt cleaning the room and the front desk was very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the charm of this historic hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: If your going to an event at the Moscone Center, you can't beat The Pickwick. Also The Westfield Shopping Center is just a few doors down.

review.title: Better looking from the outside
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located centrally (a block away from Powell St) and looks appealing from the outside. However the rooms are disappointing. Everything looks old: the room, the closets and bathroom. The cable for the TV seems clearly added on later and shows poor workmanship. The wifi was most disappointing. It kept dropping and the d/w rates were very poor.

I'd not recommend this place. Not for the price (which seems excessive given the quality) nor for location. There are plenty of other options.

review.title: Business
review.reviewText: Good place to stay on business. Clean, staff are pleasant.  Location is good and the price is right.

review.title: Old and tiny
review.reviewText: Do not stay here. Spend more money and go somewhere else.

review.title: Keep Your Expectations Low
review.reviewText: Surprised by indifferent front desk staff (except Jennifer).  Room was in desperate need of repainting as there was at least 4 coats of paint on everything.  Bed was uncomfortable. It felt like I was sleeping on a box spring and it sounded like it too.  Walls are paper thin.  You can hear everything in the surrounding rooms and hallway. Stayed for two nights.  Not sure I'd return unless the rooms are updated and the front desk staff is better trained.
review.positiveRemarks: Jennifer at the front desk was the shining light during our entire stay.  She was empathetic, action-oriented and customer focused.  Thanks, Jennifer!
review.negativeRemarks: Update and upgrade rooms including beds. Remove multiple layers of paint that have been applied to all walls.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Comfortable hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay at the hotel. Very clean and comfortable rooms!
review.locationRemarks: Close to transportation and shopping. Some good restaurants near by as well.

review.title: business meeting
review.reviewText: hotel is nicley situated downtone, , rooms getting a bit shabby
review.negativeRemarks: rooms could do with updating

review.title: Clean, but no ammenities
review.reviewText:
I stayed here when I was in town for a week for a conference. It was fine, but probably wouldn't stay here again

Pros:
-Clean.  This is the most important thing.
-Short walk to Bart

Cons:
-No safe in the room 
-No room-service at all
-They lock the doors to the hotel at night, and you need to use your room key to get inside. I wish I had known this before I came back around midnight and had to fumble through my bag while a group of guys stood right outside the door leering at me. Thanks.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean! This is my number 1 priority for a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks:
Put safes in the rooms!
Inform guests that doors will be locked at night.

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText:
perfect location to visit San Francisco; walking distance from places to see (Yerba Buena Gardens, for example) and public means stops.
my room was in decent conditions, but really small: very limited space for moving and storing.
staff was very kind and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: elevators are extremely slow

review.reviewText: Nice hotel with great history. Needs a little TLC however.

review.title: Do no pick the Pickwick
review.reviewText: This hotel is situated across the street from the US Mint building which, apparently, is a landing spot for homeless folks to "sleep" at night.  We we were often woken up by the loud yelling and emergency vehicles that traveled down Market street SEVERAL times per night.  The hotel itself was just so-so.  Only one of two very SMALL elevators was in working order during our stay so the wait to go back and forth between our room and the lobby was often several minutes long.  The house keeping staff uses the same elevator so this was definitely a hardship for them as well. The room itself was disappointing - the bed was squeaky as was the door to the bathroom.  The shower head was so low we had to squat to wash our hair.  The cable television did not seem to include the channel that was airing the playoff baseball games, so we could not watch them without going downstairs to the attached restaurant where the bartender was too busy (texting?) to take our order until we called him over.  The final disappointment came when we received our receipt and found that we were charged for a day of parking - we flew to SF and DID NOT HAVE A CAR.  The front desk attendant, Imelda, fixed the problem and reversed the charge but was completely unapologetic about it.  I would not recommend or ever stay at the Pickwick again.
review.negativeRemarks: Just about everything
review.locationRemarks: It's a 10-15 minute walk to Chinatown.  Several big name stores for shopping.  Easy access to a BART station.

review.title: Very nice old hotel.
review.reviewText: The staff was very nice and welcoming.  Parking across the street is cheaper than the hotel parking.  The room is very small, but updated.  Our king bed was very comfortable.  The walls are paper thin, and we could hear simple conversation next door.  Street side view isn't spectacular, but not bad.  We came for a Giants game, and were able to walk to it.  Close to spectacular shopping, and lots of choices for food.

review.title: No hot water
review.reviewText: Had to take a cold shower. No hot water. The room is so small for the price for a second I thought I was in Bombay.

review.title: Nice hotel, very friendly, helpful staff
review.reviewText: Close to shopping, Union Square, public transit to Fisherman's warf, and the Convention Ctr.

review.title: Close to Union square and good public transport.
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful and happy hour a bonus. Breakfasts were very ordinary and over priced
review.positiveRemarks: The Staff and close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are so outdated. No ventilation in the bathroom and door was not a proper door.

review.title: Superb location but it's a 2* hotel really.
review.reviewText: The hotel is of great convenience to San Francisco down town visitors.  25 min away on the BART form the SF International Airport as well as from Berekley.  Free wireless internet is available.  The hotel is clean but seems to be in great need of renovation.  The foyer restrooms are not presentable.  The standard hotel room I booked was badly soundproofed.  Hotel rooms adjacent to the internal courtyard suffer noise and vibration for the air conditioning system outside.  The air conditioning systems inside the room was from 1990s and not noisy though the mini-fridge from the same vintage was (fortunately it could be switched off).  The room was missing convenient wall sockets and lacked space by West European standards for a 3* hotel.  Luckily the storage room, almost as a walk in wardrobe was huge, unfortunately with no wall sockets and no light in it so the iron and ironing board could not be used for purpose in there.  The bathroom was small and very cosy but not well sound proofed from the hotel room.  The bath tub was awfully worn out (acrylic layer missing around the syphon) and the shower hardly functioned as even at max debit most of the water was coming out of the tap below.  The coffee machine was a nice touch but interestingly no milk/cream pods was supplied with the coffee capsules.  If hotel rooms are booked by hotel's website one may get free breakfast.  A minute gym facility exists for the devoted.  So does a small internet area for guests.  Pick a luxury room!
review.negativeRemarks: Interior, bathrooms, restrooms in the lobby area.

review.title: Very central Hotel with decent Room Quality
review.reviewText:
Aging but nice hotel with a fantastically central location in SFO. Great for exploring the city by foot and just around the corner from the Powell BART station. Room quality was decent - did not find anything to complain. Did not spend much time in room so did not explore hotel services. 
Only grouse was that receptionists were not friendly (though not rude). 
Price is not very cheap if you take hotel age into account - I found that the Marriot Courtyard has competitive rates and may have been a better choice for a small amount more.
Be warned on this hotel's cancellation policy. Any change - I mean ANY change will not be entertained and they will point you to Expedia. Even if you check in and want to leave a day earlier then planned, the Hotel staff will flat out refuse any responsibility and ask you to call Expedia. And you don't want to be calling Expedia and wait for a couple of hours to connect while on holiday!
review.positiveRemarks:
Central Location - one of the best in downtown SFO
Fairly competitive cost for the location.
Comfortable rooms
review.negativeRemarks:
Reception Service
Terms of booking modification
Not washing your hands off any Expedia booking change. If you don't like Expedia, don't list there!

review.title: Great location for shoppers
review.reviewText: Great location for shopping and accessing transportation.  The hotel staff was a bit hard to work with - could not get more than one non-feather pillow and did not provide extra towels when requested.  Concierge would only talk to my brother, not me (I am female).  Very little water pressure on the top floor.  However, the location made up for some of the problems.
review.negativeRemarks: Service from staff
review.locationRemarks: Much shopping within blocks.  Easy to get to cable cars and other transportation.  Short walk to many good restaurants and theaters.

review.title: Its an old building but!
review.reviewText: Well i stayed one night at this hotel for leisure.  As i parked i noticed the building is very old. Once i entered i noticed how clean and nice this hotel is. The staff was great and greeted me in a timely fashion.  The room is small as is the bathroom.  Other than the size of the bathroom i cant really say anything bad about the hotel. It was a pleasant experience.  I would definantly stay there again.

review.title: If you like fire trucks
review.reviewText:
Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Bathroom was clean but dated. Same for lobby which needs some work.  

Room was facing the street which tends to be very noisy. Unfortunately there is a fire station one block away and apparently the area of the city is busy for the fire department. 3 sirens a night was the norm.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient city location free wifi and in room Keurig for coffee.  Bedding was clean and comfortable.  Good pillows
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to great restaurants and shopping in the area

review.title: Cozy and well located
review.reviewText: We got upgraded to an apartment suite, which was really excellent! Very spacious, well designed, and clean! Location is prime, right downtown SF. Price is fair, overall good experience.

review.title: Really basic room to sleep
review.reviewText:
The room was not super clean but just OK. The window was broken, leading to having quite a noisy room and they did not fix it for the three nights I was there even though i mentioned it to the service agent. The Internet connection in the room is really not great but it is good in the lobby. The Air conditioning could not be adjusted in the room. 
The bed and pillows were quite nice, which still allowed for a comfortable sleep....
The location is very nice and the staff is professional as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connection

review.title: OK if you're on a budget
review.reviewText: The staff are great, but the rooms are nothing to get excited about

review.title: good location, old, bad wifi
review.reviewText: rooms and bathrooms was very small. noisy 2nd floor, wireless was horrible to non existent
review.positiveRemarks: great location, close to all near downtown
review.negativeRemarks: wifi, room prepared with ac, better refrigerators and tv

review.title: Great little boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Very convenient and comfortable.  Friendly staff. Room nicelyset up with all the comforts I would expect in a much more expensive hotel

review.title: Everything you need
review.reviewText: Good location, has everything you need, room is a little small but more than adequate and nicely furnished, free wifi and close to lots of transport and shopping
review.positiveRemarks: staff were helpful and free wi-fi, good central location
review.locationRemarks: Really close to trams and trains, art galleries close by, lots of shopping

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here over the forth of July, really nice hotel for the price.  I'd stay here again

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: There is a ton of things to do within walking distance.  Lots of great food nearby.  If you don't want to drive, there is plenty of transit stops too.

review.title: Perfect spot to see San Fran
review.reviewText: Price was right staff great right area no worrys of bums and there are a lot in the city

review.title: Jewel of a hotel in the heart of the City
review.reviewText: We stayed for two nights at this lovely hotel just south of Market Street.  Although we checked in early, our room was ready for us.  The hotel staff was friendly.  Because it is a small hotel there is not a lot of staff.  The concierge doubled at a bellman, but there was always someone around when you needed assistance.  Because it is a small hotel, the hotel staff greeted us by name as we came and went, which added a nice personal touch.  The hotel is clean and comfortable and in a lovely old building that was clearly updated recently.  The room was very very small, which might bother some people, but we found that it is was so well appointed and so cleverly laid out that we did not mind the size.    A restaurant with an entrance off the lobby serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The first night we were exhausted and had dinner at the hotel restaurant ("Soma").  It was fine meal at a reasonable price and the service was excellent.  All in all a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The charm, the personal service, and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are probably too small for families, but for couples or single traveler it was great.  The parking is expensive, but that  seems unavoidable
review.locationRemarks: The location is great.  It is convenient to all kinds of buses as well as the cable car starting point.  It is also right near Union Square.

review.title: Aging hotel that was a bit pricy for what you get.
review.reviewText:
Most of these comments are probably typical for many hotels in SoMa (south of Market Street district of downtown San Francisco) but since we were charged 2-3x the normal rate during the Google I/O conference for an aging hotel experience, I wanted to share them.  The staff was friendly and the double beds were very comfortable but the hotel definitely shows it's age.  The street was also very noisy with sometimes Ambulances and Firetrucks blaring every 5-10 minutes as early as 5-6 in the morning.  Before 7am on our second night there, the entire building fire alarms went off and we all ran outside in our pajamas as the Fire Department showed up, came in for 5 minutes, and left.  It would have been nice to get an explanation from the staff but none came and understandably they were probably getting inundated with not-so-pleasant calls from customers that day.  

The pipes also screech very loudly when people shower so if someone next to you takes a very early shower, chances are you'll be getting up with them unless you've bought earplugs in advance.  Also, there is not a huge amount of sound proofing and if you have a child next to your room or loud adults they will definitely become part of your room atmosphere whether you like it or not.  

Anyway, not trying to be over critical but we payed a pretty high rate for our room during the conference (which is kinda expected).  I don't plan on staying at this hotel again which is likely the best way to voice my opinion.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Moscone Center for Google I/O conference, beds were very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing between walls, noisy pipes, soundproofing from street, overall condition of rooms/amenities, this place seems to just need a little TLC
review.locationRemarks: Lots of nice restaurants, close to Moscone Center, lots to do in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Good place at the price
review.reviewText: I stayed there one night for a conference at the St. Regis, two blocks away, because the St. Regis was booked up. Nothing special but I'd stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are clean and comfortable. There's a desk with a comfortable chair. And power outlets are accessible .
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure was low, and WiFi was bad even by hotel-WiFi standards. Food at the pub associated with the hotel was mediocre.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the convention center, downtown, restaurants, coffee shops.

review.title: Great price and location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location in downtown San Fran. You can very easily get unto public trans to get anywhere in the city from its location. Granted, it is not in 100% condition but it is comfortable.

review.title: historic hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: close to BART, near UOP, my destination. Clean, cute historic hotel. Rooms smallish but very comfortable, comfortable bed, cool tub, excellent restaurant in the hotel.. great food. I had a good stay. Being downtown, street noise at night. (.with quiet periods) even with double windows. I would go back to stay again tho..if in the area. Overall-cute nice hotel...
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent food in the onsite restaurant, cute historic detail, great location, clean comfortable room
review.negativeRemarks: provide earplugs for light sleepers..as the street noise is evident
review.locationRemarks: on fifth St., near Market street. The Moscone Center, Westfield Mall, UoP, Cable cars, BART, Art Mueseum are all near by.

managementResponses.response: Thank you! We look forward to having you back with us again in the near future.

review.reviewText: Great location. Close to shopping, eating, and entertainment.

managementResponses.response: Hi Kristin, Thank you for taking the time to post your experiences about the hotel. We will definitely look into the fridge and wires and make sure that all are in working order. Looking forward to having you with us again soon!

review.reviewText: The location is great. The TV and Keurig were nice touches. However, the refrigerator didn't work and there were exposed wires by the baseboard. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. Overall, not a bad choice for a short stay.

review.title: Nice hotel very convenient to the Moscone Center
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and very pleasant. The staff were helpful. The room was small but was more than adequate for 2 of us. It was very convenient to the Moscone Center where I attended meetings. Overall, I was pleased with my choice, would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to a friend. I had no problem with my Expedia reservation.

review.title: this is a great location next to a big mall
review.reviewText: it is a very nice hotel and close to shopping. i try to stay there as often as i can/.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Well located hotel, old structure, though they have tried to upgrade the rooms. Staff is friendly and helpful.

review.title: A great location in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Among the best ones in my life, really! The location is terrific and all people working there is really nice.

review.title: Nice hotel near Mosconi Center
review.reviewText:
I don't get some of the bad reviews, have the reviewers never been to a city?

The area is decent, the food around the area is good, and you are in walking distance to ATT park.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Pickwick is located in a great location near all of the museums in SoMa and shopping in Union Square. There is also very good nightlife around the area and easy access to BART and other transportation. The hotel was clean and service was quick & easy.

review.title: Great Location, Nice staff and Bedding
review.reviewText: It's a really great location in SF near Union Square and Moscone. The bathroom is very very small and the water pressure was not consistent on the shower. The staff were incredibly nice, free wifi, no extra hidden "resort" fees, and really great bedding.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom, Shower
review.locationRemarks: Union Square / Market Location, right beside Moscone (2 blocks). Next to the major Mall and Nordstrom.

review.title: Nice hotel Expedia price deal $113.00.
review.reviewText: This hotel close to all Union Square venues, all within walking distance. I would stay here again.

review.title: Nice and affordable hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: Very good experience overall. The interior may not be the most modern but it is clean and well kept.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were friendly and professional. Could not asked for more.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the BART station.

review.title: Sweet!
review.reviewText: Cozy boutique hotel right off Market St in the heart of SF. It is a great value as one could easily spend the times more for a sterile, bland chain hotel room. But what really makes this place is the friendliness of the staff. It was so unexpected in the heart of a big city.

review.title: Needs a redo
review.reviewText: Nice location! Cool decor throughout hotel...however....we stayed Thursday thru Sunday...room 625.... Windows are not in working order....some won't open some won't close....please replace windows in this hotel....Roma Restaurant on site is an outstanding restaurant. Very pleased with the check-in / check out ....
review.negativeRemarks: Facility needs windows
review.locationRemarks: Nice location near heart of downtown....sushi bar next door, coffee shop across the street....mall within a block....Denny's 2 blocks

review.title: Good location and well priced.
review.reviewText: This hotel is OK . Needs an update but is well priced and comfortable.Good location for shopping and train station. Give the hotel restaurant a miss.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom and restaurant in lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all the shops and dept stores,close to train station.Easy access from airport.

review.title: Good accomodation close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Paid the standard rate but got a good corner room on level 5. Room size was larger than I'm used to staying in San Francisco. Clean and tidy with comfortable bed. Furniture is quirky.
review.negativeRemarks: All good for me - some might say it is a bit dated, but that is part of the charm.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping, restaurants, bars nearby.

review.title: Incredibly dis-interested staff
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel because we were looking for something central to seminar we were attending. That was about the only thing going for it-location! The Pickwick is in dire need of some overall maintenance, and cleaning. It's staff supplied marginal customer service, and seemed totally dis-interested in their customers, not to mention their surrounds.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness and maintenance

review.title: Not what I was expecting
