review.reviewText: Perhaps the Expedia bookings are low on the totem pole but I was surprised at how disappointing my stay was. It happened to be an unseasonably warm month so the room, being with AC, was warm and muggy. The windows opened right onto the exhaust/ventilation system for the hotel so I had to choose between temperature and noise/smell. There was zero air circulation. On the positive side, the room was clean and the staff was very friendly. There are no restaurants in the building but there are a few very close by and great Chinese delivery and catching a cab out front took a total of 30 seconds.
review.locationRemarks: As a woman traveling alone I opted not to walk through the neighborhood, lots of homeless/pan handlers. But nice restaurants next door

review.positiveRemarks: Met my needs well. Perfect location. Good price. Nice sized room.
review.negativeRemarks: The pillow roll/sham thing as well as the thing they drape across the foot of the bed had numerous stains on them which made the room seem more seedy

review.title: Close to family
review.reviewText: Just needed something simple to be close to our daughter for Christmas and this fit the bill. Clean and comfortable for a reasonable price.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText:
My friend & I stayed here for
6 nights over the Christmas holidays. The beds are like a big cloud, so comfy. The staff is very friendly. We got to know the door guys & they always joked with us. Leo helped us book a town car to pick us up at 4:30am to take us to the airport with a good cheap price. The hotel is right in the center of downtown so we walked many places or just hopped onto the F line. Very conveniently located. Will def be back!

This hotel was great for one person attending a conference at the Moscone Convention Center. The location is convenient, the staff are friendly, and there are good restaurants nearby. Soma, in the ground floor, is excellent for dinner, and Cafe Varona, a few doors down, is also excellent for breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the staff, the fact that I could get to my 2nd floor room without using the elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: The annoying shelf right above the bathroom basin, and the fact that you you have to run the water forever to get it hot.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect if you are attending something at the Moscone center.

review.title: Small but centrally licated
review.reviewText: We got down graded to a queen because our room wasn't ready, even though I called ahead to get an early check in. The concierge services were great very personal. The hotel room was small but in good condition and clean. The pillows were awesome.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Pickwick Hotel in San Francisco and will make it my hotel of choice on upcoming visits. The location was perfect for my needs. The staff is the best. I arrived early and had no problem checking in.
review.positiveRemarks: I especially enjoyed the décor of my room.

review.title: You will not get any sleep.
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was nice. Our bed was comfortable. BUT..... The noises you will hear are terrible! And we are not picky travelers. We stayed on the 4th floor, away from the street. But we heard sirens all night, yelling on the street, someone THROWING glass bottles into a recycling bin several nights in a row. Our room didn't have a fan to cancel out all the noise! I tried sleeping pills every night, but it still wasn't enough. My sister woke up early to shower, and she got blasted with freezing water 4 minutes into her shower. When you try to adjust the water temperature, the pipes shake and rattle in the walls. I'm sure our neighbor enjoyed that noise....
We will not stay here again. We got no sleep and ended up exhausted and caught a cold.

review.title: The best Services
review.reviewText: Greg and Louie made our stay incredible. The service we received was "Above & Beyond". Greg and Louie always had a smile and went out of their way to cater to us.

review.title: Friendly staff, but accommodations need update
review.reviewText:
We had some issues with our flight that were out of our control, so we called ahead to let the hotel know about the situation. They were helpful and checked us in the night before our actual arrival, without charging us for the night. Everyone at the hotel were very friendly and helpful.
The building itself is centrally located in the South of Market district and very convenient to walk to a lot of places including the SFMoMA and the Metreon. Even with the busy street outside of our window, we did not hear outside noise at any point of our stay.
There were two areas that we feel need improvement: the bed and the shower. Our king bed was spacious, but it was too firm and we could not fall into deep sleep, which is unusual for us. We both woke up with aching necks. The shower took longer than expected (at least 5 minutes) to get hot water out of it. The shower head itself could have performed better too. Overall, we liked the hotel and would stay here again if the beds are comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Better bed and shower
review.locationRemarks: Breakfast at M'oz Cafe Lunch at Fresh Rolls shopping at Target

review.title: Nice but a little noisy.
review.reviewText: This is a nice, older hotel with a very convenient location near Union Square. The only downside is that we had a lot of street noise. We were only there one night, a Saturday, it might be less noisy on other nights.

review.title: Good location exploited and left old and run down
review.reviewText: We paid a ridiculous price for this room solely for its location. The care of the hotel rooms is terrible. Old paint, nasty walls, tiny room, tiny bathroom, microscopic closet, sticking doors, filthy moldings, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the lobby and the free internet.
review.negativeRemarks: The place needs to be gutted and remodeled. Would not stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of activities, restaurants and shopping.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: I loved the location, however the hotel is very old.

review.title: Hotel missed its "best before date"
review.reviewText:
I am a traveller who can appreciate boutique to run down to preserved traditional. This hotel i guess makes no pretentions to be any of the three but probably is run down at best. The funny thing is it wouldnt take much effort to become a preserved trad hotel if the room cleaners cleaned and the hallways were maintained for more than an hour a year. Yes it has TV and wifi but the shower/tub toilet looked and performed like something out of a movie.
I have stayed in french hotels where plumbing barely existed but you wake up to Paris and a great breakfast/coffee included for the price. This place offers a front desk clerk who points to the "eating room" as the place where one pays to chow down. Thanks i skipped that banal offer and went off to union square for a cheaper better set up.
For the price this place aint worth it, unless of course you have stumbled on an offer below 100.00.
review.negativeRemarks: List is long. Requires thought. Maybe there is a condo building planned for its footprint.
review.locationRemarks: Good question.

review.title: old building, not maintained
review.reviewText:
old building, bathroom with inadequate facilities, broken furniture, air-conditioning nonfunctional, staff non-cooperative and electric appliances old, electeric plugs and adaptors not available in the hotel,
had charged us$ 40 as a security and have not returned
review.negativeRemarks: should be changed from three star to one star
review.locationRemarks: powell station

review.title: Nice hotel. Centrally located in the city
review.reviewText: Clean room. Staff was very helpful. Bed and room were very comfortable

review.title: Decent hotel, excellent location.
review.reviewText: Very simple hotel. Small but clean rooms. Did not check out the fitness center to comment on it. Some rooms are smaller and noisy. The staff were friendly and willing to move me to a different room. The biggest plus for the hotel is the location. It is within walking distance of union square, moscone center and excellent restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: The main could be improved. The internet connection is very slow.

review.title: Avarage hotel, to expensive, great location
review.reviewText: Room so small we couldn't fit 2 suitcases, had to jump over bags. Bathroom tiny no space. View into a stone wall. Loud ventilation that couldn't be turned of that kept us awake. Not very helpful staff. Close to great shopping. Expected must more for the price we paid.

review.title: Very pleasant hotel close to everything important
review.reviewText:
Most enjoyable stay in a cosy stylish traditionnal hotel .The welcome at the reception was cold unfortunately.I managed by myself,but as everything was thought before hand by the room staff it was allright.
Excellent situation close to Bart ,cable car station, buses, stores ;visitors' center ,Union Square.
restaurants nearby,or if you are on your own ,Bristol Farm or other food facilities propose tasty dishes.

However I would go back and recommend it highly.

Good value with the flight.
review.negativeRemarks: Welcome at the reception.
review.locationRemarks: within a couple of minutes of all means of transportation,stores round the corner ,the MOMA ,jewish museum ,10 ' and 5 ' minutes walk.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for four days and were happy with our experience. Our room was very small but had everything we needed. This is an older hotel but the rooms are nicely updated and the washroom was very modern. The staff at the hotel were happy to help us plan our day trips around San Francisco and the hotel is in a great location

review.title: Romantic night in the city
review.reviewText: We loved our room on the 7th floor, we got a corner room and had great views of the city. The toiletries were Bath & Body Works, which I love, everything was so clean and nice & the bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Rude Guest Services
review.reviewText:
There was a complaint of noise coming from my room, which would be impossible because no one was talking at the time. Instead of coming up to my room to investigate the complaint and make sure it was the correct room the hotel guest service employee felt it was more professional to rudely call me and threaten to kick me out of the hotel. Mind you it was 10pm at night and it was me and another girl. Both in our late 20's.
When I asked what the complaint was, and tried to explain that it could not have been us, he rudely told me to keep it down and hung up on me. I then called back asking to speak to a manager, and he refused. Said he didnt have a manager . I then asked for his name, he refused again and hung up on me. Not only do I find their hotel guest services rude but also extremely unprofessional. I travel a lot and have never experienced anything like that.
I will say the gentleman I spoke to the next morning was more understanding and professional. It appears their staff needs a refresher in customer service.
WILL NEVER GO BACK TO THIS HOTEL
.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing, it is in a horrible area.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Aside from shopping there is nothing to do. The areas is unsafe to walk around at night. Homeless and junkies outside the hotel.

review.title: Great Central Location
review.reviewText: Within one block of Bart station, cable cars and wonderful shopping. Hotel staff was very helpful in assisting with sightseeing and travel. Rooms were comfortable and very clean.
review.locationRemarks: Walk one block to catch cable car to Fisherman's Wharf or to catch streetcars or buses to Embarcadero, the ball park and Golden Gate Park.

review.title: big city at your doorstep
review.reviewText:
perfection on every level except:
the bathroom has no workable space for us ladies & all of our makeup & toiletries!
that is my only gripe (but it might not affect others )
however, the room #701 was perfect: comfy not too cramped & clean..
great city views, modern decor (complete w/iphone charger --but not the new model phone)
helpful & professional desk staff
bus stops to every tourist attraction you need are all steps w/in the hotel, also the bart station.. trust me.. a block away
so many shops super close by for your apparel & food needs!
very very inexpensive & quite the non-motel feel ..
will only stay here in the future!
review.positiveRemarks: location, price, staff & overall big city vibe
review.negativeRemarks: adding more shelf space in the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: mega levi's store, trolley stop & bart station, smugglers cove tiki bar

review.title: close to shopping and at&t park
review.reviewText: great experience...except I was told I was getting a king bed and recieved 2 double beds...kind of upset.
review.negativeRemarks: offere the correct bed when reservations are made
review.locationRemarks: shopping and giants game

review.title: Nice hotel, very close to the convention center
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, just wish the wifi worked all the time, some times the connections were very slow.
review.negativeRemarks: wifi - didn't use it a lot, it was too slow.
review.locationRemarks: Lots to eat, shop, shop and shop.

review.title: Decent location with tolerable accommodations
review.reviewText: This hotel was all that was available within a few blocks of the Moscone Convention Center. It was rated at a 3 stars so I knew what to expect but the pictures were a little bit deceiving.
review.positiveRemarks: It was conveniently located near the convention center.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell of the hotel was pretty stale and overall it was pretty humid inside so that could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Near the convention center and convenient access to downtown and cable cars.

review.title: Nice location for shopping
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. The staff was friendly and rooms clean. Rooms were a little hot and only one small window. Weird noises and we were on the 8th floor, so not sure what was clicking all night. Housekeeping wokw us up at 9am sharp and were ready to clean and almost walked in on us in bed.Shower had very weak shower pressure and water changed temperature and pressure while you showered.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower pressure and temperature
review.locationRemarks: Shopping

review.title: Stay somewhere else
review.reviewText:
From the first moment of entering the hotel the front desk wasn't attentive or even acted like they cared that I was there to check in. Nobody wore name tags and nobody even said welcome to the hotel. The room wasn't maintained and under the nightstand hadn't been cleaned in what looked like years. The bathroom was clean looking but as you looked closer you could see mold on the shower curtains.

This experience is coming from someone who worked in the hospitality field and I can certainly tell you that nobody at this hotel has been trained to do their jobs like you would expect.
review.positiveRemarks: I wanted a boutique historic hotel which is what is advertise but all I got was a run downed motel 6, no sorry because motel 6 is better.
review.negativeRemarks: staff training!!!
review.locationRemarks: There are a lot of sight seeing areas around the hotel such as the cable car and china town.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText:
The location is just the right distance to everywhere.

The hotel is pretty old... for $170/night, it is not that impressed but ok.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms are too old
review.locationRemarks: DT area with lots of stores

review.title: Old and tired
review.reviewText:
The Pickwick Hotel has the potential of being a chic boutique hotel right in an up and coming area of town. Unfortunately, little investment has been made in the hotel and it is obvious in the tired decor and the strong smell of grandma's house from the rugs and rooms in general.

Nothing horrible about the situation, but disappointing overall. The same can be said about the adjacent restaurant/bar.

review.title: Great Hotel Stay
review.reviewText: My experience at the Pickwick was pleasant. We we're a little nervous to leave our car with the Valet, because we were unaware that it was only Valet parking. The lobby was quite nice and elegant. Our room had a great view of the city and windows that actually opened up which was nice to get fresh air in.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was very luxurious and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Notify guests as to where to park. The parking structure was a little hidden and obscure. Also inform guests that it is valet parking.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to AT&T Park from the hotel, about a 15-20 minute walk.

review.title: Charm, great location, thin walls, the homeless
review.reviewText: This was a very good experience staying here in downtown San Francisco. We both loved the old-fashioned charm of the decor. Unfortunately, it also means that the buildiing is quite old, which means very thin walls. Outside of that, we enjoyed the room. The desk clerks were nice and the concierge was very helpful and accurate about getting around. Within a short walk, there were a variety of restaurants, Powell Station which is a hub for all forms of public transportation, and a fantastic multi-level mall. The only downside to the location is the prevalence of homeless people. They were several within one block. But this is not the fault of the hotel. The city should really find a solution to this. Something is wrong with the distribution of wealth if there is a very high concentration of millionnaires yet so many homeless in the same area. Anyway, staying here gave us an excellent sense of what the city is like in downtown. And this was one of the cheapest three-star hotels in the area. By the way, there are usually better dining options outside of the attached restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: The old-world charm in decor; downtown location near Powell Station; helpful concierge; free WiFi.
review.negativeRemarks: Add sound-proofing to the walls; add a non-stick bathtub mat and handles for getting in and out; add temperature control in room.
review.locationRemarks: There is a major hub for public transportation nearby, plus a variety of restaurants & malls. Unfortunately, there are several homeless around.

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: We go to San Francisco every year for a music festival. Normally the rates around this time are high because of all the festivalers coming through. I've always stayed at the same hotel but this year, their rates were through the roof. We never spend much time in our room so we're not too picky with where we stay as long as the location is good. Because of the affordable price and great location, we chose to stay at the Pickwick. This is now our new go-to hotel. The staff was nice and helpful. The rooms were a bit bigger than what we are used to and a lot newer/cleaner decor. Definitely a great deal for the price!

review.title: Hotel Pickwick
review.reviewText: Overall it was in a good location, close to transportation and Market St. We did buy a 3 day city transp pass but we found it very difficult to use not having had any experience. Used taxi mostly and actually our taxi drivers were very entertaining and actually spoke English! We used Super Shuttle from airport and found them very reliable.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were very good and the pillows were great. The staff was excellent! It was handy having restaurant right there.
review.negativeRemarks: Old hotel so can't change size but still comfortable. Didn't have a fan in bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Market and 5th. Lots of shopping nearby and some entertainment!! on the square. Next time I would stay closer to the PIER

review.title: Great hotel near shopping and Moscone
review.reviewText: The Pickwick place is an older hotel with character, and it's been maintained. I TRULY enjoyed my stay. The staff was wonderful the entire time. Always pleasant, helpful, professional. The room was exceptionally clean, and the bed was VERY comfortable. They offered an assortment of pillows with a compfy pillow top. I was very cozy in the bed. The room had its own Keurig and I received two coffee pods with the room (no extra charge). I really like Keurig coffee, so that was a plus. The only suggestion to other guests is bring ear plugs. The San Fran weather enticed me to keep my window open- it was lovely, but the noise on the street was annoying. I wish I had remembered ear plugs for middle of the night. But that was only Friday night-Thursday was fairly quiet. Normal city noise. I used the business center to print my boarding pass, everything worked well. I also used the fitness center and the treadmill was good. They had some weights and eliptical. Didn't seem to be in high demand, but it was really good for a free work out room. Finally, the free-in-room wireless was very good! I was very happy with my stay and would highly recommend the Pickwick to a friend.
review.positiveRemarks: location, comfortable bed, felt safe, clean, coffee maker, refrigerator in room, ice maker just down the hall, free work out room, great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: It was wonderful, but I recommend bringing ear plugs if you like to leave the windows open to enjoy the San Fran weather- there is some street noise.
review.locationRemarks: Handy location only one block from Moscone center, near shopping, within easy walking distance of public transport. Jogged to the warf from hotel

review.title: Great location small rooms
review.reviewText: The rooms were tiny but clean. Shower was cold 2/3 days bathroom door didnt close in the first room we were in but we were changed to a new room when we asked. Location was perfect for all public transportation which was what we were looking for. Concierge was super helpful and with just a three day stay most of the staff greeted us by name.
review.negativeRemarks: Showers. Decor, large mirrors with paintings hung awkwardly on them.
review.locationRemarks: All public transport options within a block. Union square and multiple shopping areas within 5 blocks.

review.title: A great option for a reasonable price in SF
review.reviewText: We loved our experience at the Pickwick. Nicely renovated room, comfortable amenities, everything we needed. Close to the metro and bus system for getting around town. Within walking distance of several good restaurants. The staff was helpful, cheerful and attentive. We repeatedly said how thankful we were to have found such a nice hotel in such a good location for such a reasonable price in San Francisco. Yes, we would return! P.S. No, this is NOT a ritzy, destination hotel but that is NOT what we were expecting. A nice place to sleep after a day of sightseeing with a warm shower and soft bed! Yes, it is an older hotel but that was what we knew ahead of time so we didn't expect a room with a view, a spa experience or terry cloth bathrobes. That isn't what we paid for --- not at this reasonable price! This was a lovely renovated hotel that provides above average service! Thanks for a lovely time in SF!

review.title: Great hotel in the mix! Everything you need
review.reviewText:
We arrived super late for our reservations, issues at the airport (that's another story)
Walking in, the staff was great, to our room immediately. We even called before we arrived and they helped us find parking.
Great place, clean, a bit cozy but great overall. Would definitely stay at the Pickwick again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was convenient and down the street from many attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were on the small side, but the building is an older building. No improvement needed honestly.
review.locationRemarks: There's Mels Diner (not the original), Market Street and you can get a ride on the cable cars, just blocks away!

review.title: Handy location
review.reviewText:
Handy location to Union Square area.

First room we got was on the top floor behind the elevator - very noisy with the elevator engines running all day. We were moved to another room which was fine.

review.title: Small hotel rooms but great location
review.reviewText: The parking is $40 a day and the parking staff was very rude! But the hotel staff was really nice. The rooms are really small and the bathroom is even smaller. The beds were comfortable but the walls at really thin and you can hear EVERYTHING. This is a good hotel for SF I've seen worst.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms need to be more modern toilets look like a public bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Alot of Shops

review.title: Nice and centrallly located
review.reviewText: Nice and cozy place, easy access to everything. Helpful staff. Charming place.

review.title: Hotel good walking distance to lots of places
review.reviewText:
We stayed here in order to be close to the AT&T Stadium. It was a bit of a hike but not bad. Close to Union Square. The hotel is old and on a VERY busy street, so is noisy early in the morning. It was clean with a great bed and amenities. I would stay there again, but would ask to not be on an outside room. There is a restaurant next door which is especially handy for breakfast.

Parking is in the basement and was $40 per night, but that cost is normal for San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Better windows with more sound proofing.
review.locationRemarks: The Convention center, walking to Union Square, easy access to the freeway, walking distance to AT&T Stadium.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff!
review.reviewText: I booked 1 night here as a treat for myself (I am currently traveling for 3 months) and saw this hotel on Expedia. It was very impressive and great value! The bed was huge and comfortable and very light and airy. The bathroom was super clean too.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing to improve on
review.locationRemarks: Its central to everything!

review.title: Worn out, terrible wifi, an ok budget stay
review.reviewText: Terrible wifi. Anyone who is dependent on a reasonable Internet connection, especially for work, avoid this hotel. Other than that, the place was tolerable. An old and worn out feel to it. Sadly it's not much cheaper to stay here because of that - nicer hotels are available for the same price in the same area (close to Moscone, in my case)
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location, 2 blocks to Moscone

review.title: Not near as close to the ballpark as it seemed.
review.reviewText: Long walk to ballpark and parking was $40.00 for the night with no valet. Also the bar and restaurant closed early so we had no place to have a cocktail when we got back from the game. Room was nice enough for an old hotel and it was clean.

review.title: Close to Union Square, Moscone Center
review.reviewText:
San Francisco's Pickwick Hotel is a reasonably priced botique hotel in the heart of the Mission district providing easy access to most of San Francisco's famed shopping, dining, and attractions.

We were facing the street and were concerned about traffic noise. YES, you are going to hear sirens pretty frequently as this is downtown San Francisco. Fortunate for us, we are sound sleepers so we only heard these traffic related noises while awake.

Being nearly a hundred year old building, rooms at the Pickwick are small. We knew this going in and had accepted it before we got there. So, not another peep about room size here.

We were very pleased with the comfort of the bed. Not to firm, and not too soft. Plenty of pillows for the two of us and thick down comforter (probably faux). Not your typical hotel linens. We found the A/C and Heater controls to be easy to operate and accurate for comfortable climate control.

Staff were all polite and eager to please.

Bathroom had been updated and outfitted with a pleasing tile and luxurious looking faucets and hardware. HOT water was abundant at all hours. Be careful, the water can be scalding hot - this is good in my opinion.

My only complaint was debunked by my lovely wife when I thought that the black out curtains were too hard to draw. My wife pointed out that you simply push up on the draw rods before swinging left or right.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything we needed that weekend.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness

review.title: Our Hotel Experience
review.reviewText: Location good, easy to get to from airport. Concierge very helpful. Did not like the Soma Restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Near shopping areas

review.title: Eh
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Pickwick for his first time ever in San Francisco. It was an ok hotel, pretty clean, and the staff was helpful. I booked through Expedia and when we got there, they gave us a room with 2 full size beds. When we went down to the front desk, they switched our room to a queen right away. The restaurant was not very good at all, and the hotel itself was kind of creepy. The walls were paper thin, and we could hear full conversations and when our neighbors brushed their teeth! The main reason I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone is because of it's location. We're not really fans of the Union Square area, it turns out. There were bums everywhere and it was so loud right outside our window; I'm pretty sure a firetruck went down 5th at least every 20 minutes. It's not a bad hotel, if you're into that kinda thing.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: This place is OK for one night or two nights. There was no hot water for showering and that is a deal breaker if I were to book again. Excellent location however, close to Union Square and a mile from AT&T Park.
review.negativeRemarks: Luke warm water for showering
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for Union Square and AT&T Ballpark

review.title: Cheap hotel and you get the price you pay for
review.reviewText: The hotel is much inexpensive than most hotels in San Francisco. However, the room are outdated the cooler was over used and did not work well as I expected. I was in a stuffy room in my two day stay. Also, the bathrooms were also outdated and needs to pipe systems. The rooms had an odd smell and the bathroom doors would not close right. Yes, the owners of this hotel should invest on updating everything in this hotel. The lobby is lovely though and the customer service were cordial and helped you the best way they can. The perks about staying in this hotel is the location which is in the center of everything. I did all my shopping in one day and went for another round the following day.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need to be updated and need new everything

review.title: Great location but watch the rates
review.reviewText:
The hotel was fine. We wanted something close to the Metreon NCLR event we attended, and the Pickwick was an easy stroll. It is also very easily accessible to public transit, so we left the car in the garage until checking out. On that note, $40 for parking from 3pm until 1pm the next day is ridiculous - even in SF. The Hyatt charges $22.
The room itself was fine. A little worn, but clean and reasonably comfortable. For $318, I expected better, frankly. Rooms in the city that night were priced higher than usual, or I would have booked the Hyatt Embarcadero, which is always excellent - but their available rooms started at over $400. Overall, my only complaint about our stay at the Pickwick was the price. I'm local, and stay in SF frequently, so I know I could have done better.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location! Near Powell Station. Clean, well equipped...

review.title: Pickwick Hotel, San Francisco
review.reviewText: From the sullen parking attendant to the disinteresested concierge/greeter, This Hotel offers poor, cramped, dated and peeling rooms and an overpriced restaurant adjacent, with an uninspired menu. Across the street is the old San Francisco US Mint- now host to a special events catered events and at full dark - rapidly replaced by the homeless, who camp and defecate on the front porch of this old dame. The entire area is rife with panhandlers, filth and demonstrates the incompetence of a business community slave to political correctness and willing to acquiesce to the lowest denominator. I will never return to this area or this funky hotel Poor value, nasty environs, indifferent staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Ah, geez. The parking attendant, the filthy garage, the inadequate service where I had to carry my own bags, get my own cart.
review.locationRemarks: You can be panhandled by filthy transients and observe the hygiene habots of transients camping at the Mint across the street. SF, get some resolve.

review.title: hotel is nice parking was ridiculous
review.reviewText: the hotel has very nice accommodations and it was located in a great area to get around the city
review.negativeRemarks: what I would improved I would not charge $52 for parking that was absolutely ridiculous

review.title: Staff was helpful. Room was a little small.
review.reviewText: Great location in the city. Close to everything. The staff was helpful when we asked questions. Parking charges were ridiculous I thought. Parking should be free or cheaper for guests. Room was small but accommodating. There were a few stains on the comforters, but all in all room was clean. Id definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This is a great base to explore San Fran. While the hotel is a little old, it is certainly not decrepit and holds a certain amount of charm and character
review.positiveRemarks: Great location at Union Square with access to all transport options

review.title: Regular Hotel closed to Market St.
review.reviewText:
I stayed for 15 days at this hotel and was not pleasant at all, the hotel has many small noises, and they could not help with simple things like providing a glass of hot water for a tee, the elevators are very old and often they lock when the door was opening.
The housekeeping did not refuel all the items on the cleaning and did not cleaned the carpet every day.
The only good will I found was the front desk when I asked to change the room due to the noise; she was very polite and assisted with the room change.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel has many small noises, don't help with small thinks like hot water for tee, elevators very old and often with small problems.
review.locationRemarks: Good Location close to main points

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is very centrally located and is quite cute. It's older and the staff are VERY nice. Rooms are small so don't expect a suite. Not a good idea to expect a roll-a-way to fit in a King room, it won't. King rooms are for 2 people, max. It reminds me of many quaint hotels I have stayed in in Europe. If I was not in San Francisco I would say that I was in Paris or Rome in an old walk-up. VERY nice staff and rooms were comfortable and clean. Each room has a mini fridge which is nice for leftovers and snacks. Beds were newer and had nice sheets. Lots of pillows too. If you are wanting pure luxury, this is not your hotel. If you want a nice location with a very nice, accommodating staff and clean rooms - if you don't mind that they are a bit small, this is a good hotel for you. Oh, I LOVE to open my windows at night and most newer hotels restrict that ability. This hotel has nice older windows that swing open so you can get some fresh air.
review.negativeRemarks: not much. they could use bigger rooms but that's not possible. Staff was accommodating and the place was clean and updated.
review.locationRemarks: Trolley turn around a few blocks away. Amazing mall with Bloomies, Nordies, a unique food court, cool grocery and lots of fun shops was 1/2 block away

review.title: Pickwick was a good pick
review.reviewText: The location was good: near cable car and bus routes and virtually a flat walk down market Street ( 20 mins) to the Ferry House area. The concierge was cheerfully helpful and the Reception staff accommodating when we asked to move rooms because of a screaming baby nearby. The room was elegant and well appointed, though a little smaller than most American hotel rooms. The restaurant/bar next door (called Soma - meaning south of market) was friendly and served good food at reasonable prices. Altogether a good experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Good price, good quality room, friendly service.
review.negativeRemarks: Slightly small rooms
review.locationRemarks: Great location, convenient for walking ( flat area) and close to public transport

review.title: Old build renovated, but some flaws you'll find
review.reviewText: One night quick stay. Found no cold water's coming out from facet or tub. Talk to counter in the morning. They just ignore. No time to discuss, ran to the convention.. Old building, many plumbing problem I guess.

review.title: Inexpensice hotel great location
review.reviewText: Great fr the price. No nearly as loud as others have mentioned. Small but comfortable rooms. Nice bed, no nonsense. THIS IS NOT THE RITZ. You get what you pay for. This is a very comfortable hotel for the price. Th eonly negatives, no pool or jacuzzi and no room service.
review.negativeRemarks: no room service
review.locationRemarks: close to everything including the Tenderloin. Be sure to avoid the Tenderloin.

review.title: Hotel is pretty so-so
review.reviewText: Great location, but don't expect a luxurious experience. It's a room with a bed and a shower and a few outlets. Very convenient location though.
review.negativeRemarks: There appeared to be mold on the wall...
review.locationRemarks: Awesome

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I highly recommend this hotel it is in a great location and is a great value for the money, the hotel is very comfortable and clean.

review.title: Great value for the price
review.reviewText: Clean and well-maintained hotel in the heart of SF, close to the Moscone center and an easy walk to many attractions including the cable cars. The staff were very polite, attentive, and helpful. Great value for the price!
review.locationRemarks: Close to Moscone center; cable cars, trains, buses, etc

review.title: Great hotel for the $$$
review.reviewText: Great location, clean, quiet; good safety (doorman), kind of hot in the room, air blower did not cool off the room; staff very pleasant and responsive.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot temperature in the room
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, five minutes from Powell St metro

review.title: Great hotel at a very reasonable price
review.reviewText: Incredibly friendly and helpful staff. The hotel was in a great location, centrally located in the downtown area next to shopping, restaurants, and metro / bus stations.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls were a bit thin, but noise wasn't terrible.
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: A bit of "Old San Francisco" down town.
review.reviewText:
The best thing about The Pickwick Hotel is it's location. Close to everything. The down town area, great shopping, Convention Center, fine dining and more all within a short walk or cab ride.

The hotel does show it's age in the rooms. The single queen bed room I had was small. You could touch both side walls of the bathroom at the same time. The hotel is also on a busy corner so there is some street noise. I happen to be in town when President Obama came to visit and he stayed just down the street.

If you like a place with a little more glamor than "newness" then this place is for you.

review.title: Considerable Noise
review.reviewText:
I like this hotel very much.
However, the problem is noise. We stayed at the room next to the elevator.
When the elevator was working, noise coming into our room was like a roller coaster.
The noise and voice from the neighbors of other rooms leaked out into our room, so
we could hear everything and they would be able to hear us.
And also, the terrible noise from the motors on the rooftop always bothered us in our room.
I understand this promlem is due to poor insulation of the very old building.
Needless to say, the noise problem is considerable concern because Pickwick Hotel attracts the guests for many reasons besides the noise.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from the outside and neighbors.
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful location. It is very near from the stations of all of public transportation.

review.title: Great hotel for a family
review.reviewText: Great hotel for a family, convenient location, free Wi-Fi

review.title: Great location and friendly service
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Great location. Lots of places to eat nearby. Right next to the mall and market street. Only complaint is parking is $32 per day. There are other public parking lots within walking distance that are a little cheaper. We stay in San Francisco often and many hotels have free parking. In fact, this is the first time we ever had to pay for hotel parking although I know this is not uncommon in the city. However, I do think the hotel room itself was a great price for the quality and location. I can see how the street may be a little noisey if you are on lower levels but we were on the fifth floor and had no issue with noise at all. Overall if i consider the price, comfort, cleanliness, location and service- this is one of the better ones I have stayed in and would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: parking

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for a girls night out in the city. We absolutely LOVE the location: next to the mall (Bloomingdale's entrance), across the street from 5th & Mission parking lot, a block away from the Metreon center and AMC theatres, walking distance to Union Square and many nice restaurants. The room and the bathroom were small, but the place is well kept, the beds are comfy and we got a good value.
review.negativeRemarks: Tight space
review.locationRemarks: Excellent!

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: Arrived early from an longhaul overnight flight and they allowed me to check in 3 hours early. Was great service. The rooms are a bit tired, but overall very pleasant stay and very central for my business meetings. Would stay again.

review.title: Cozy hotel
review.reviewText: Super comfy. Great location. Close to Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel for couples, families w/ older children
review.reviewText: I've stayed in this hotel on three different occasions. It has been a very pleasant visit everytime.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy. guests
review.locationRemarks: Very nice.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Location is amazing and we walked everywhere. The only draw back which is everywhere is the cost of parking is 30.00 per day at the hotel. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast and it was quite good. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Okay for business but not for romance or families
review.reviewText: The location is awesome for shopping and convention access to Mascone Center. However, amenities are not included (other than internet access). The rooms are very small. The gym is inadequate. The attached bar/grill is decent. This is a room only type of hotel so if you do not plan on spending much time at your hotel, it will suffice. The double windows are not sufficient for noise control as the street noise comes through very easily and the rooms facing 5th street are VERY noisy. The maid did not vacuum or empty the room trash during my 3 day stay which was a bit disturbing. There is also no heating or cooling so temperature control is all via the room windows (again inviting noise). The late check out of 1pm was a convenient perk but the "do not disturb" sign on the door did not keep the maid from knocking 2 times between 11am and 12:30 to ask when I was checking out.
review.negativeRemarks: Service was not outstanding and amenities were non existent
review.locationRemarks: Right next door to great shopping, a few blocks from Mascone Center & running distance to embarcadero.

review.title: Good hotel for moderate price in downtown SF
review.reviewText: The hotel is a block from the shopping center on Market street and a short walk from Union square. It is also near Mission street. You can get on buses, BART, or the cable cars about a block away. The room was small but comfortable. There is a good Mediterranean restaurant on premises and several cafes nearby as well. The room was clean. There is free wifi, and a business center for a nominal price. The price of the room was well below the prices at some of the big chain hotels nearby. The lobby is pleasant, and the concierge very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable room with fridge and good tv
review.negativeRemarks: the on premises restaurant had great food and service but was pricey, esp. for breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: South of Market, with short walk to transport or Union Square, right near shopping center

review.title: Fair value near Moscone
review.reviewText: Great location in terms of proximity to the Moscone center. Plenty of workspace off the lobby and again on the second floor. Disappointing, there was a knob busted off the thermostat and I couldn't get the fan to run. I reported the problem the first day but it was never fixed during my stay. The attached restaurant had a fairly limited menu in my opinion. Overall I thought it was fair value given the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Thermostat issues, attached restaurant was so-so.

review.title: I'd stay there again
review.reviewText: The location is great. There's a Target one block away, which cured my "I forgot something" panic; the Moscone Centet is a block and a half away - great for conference goers; it's just a short walk to Union Square and the BART, cable cars and buses. The room was small and could use an update, but it wasn't bad. They provide a fridge, which is very convenient. The staff was friendly and attentive. I would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: The decor was odd - a weird combination of traditional and modern - and could use updating. It was also a little dingy - needs freshening.
review.locationRemarks: It's located conveniently near the Mascone Center, public transp., Union Square, a short walk from Chinatown, and there's a Target down the block.

review.title: A good stop-by, not for long stays
review.reviewText: My husband and I travelled all day. Parking overnight was a bit pricey but standard for San Francisco. The room is tiny, bathroom is like staying at someone's apartment, not hotel standards. I would say if you are looking for a place to hang your hat for the night then no need to look further. But if you are looking for space and amenities, this should not be your place. I would not pay full price for this stay, even given the location.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was comfortable, and that it big for us when we travel
review.negativeRemarks: Small, small room and bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for the union square area

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Centrally located. Clean rooms. Parking on site. Very happy with the choice.

review.title: Moscone Center friendly
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and nice decor. Convenient to the Moscone Center and reasonably priced.

review.title: Poor Quality
review.reviewText: One of the staff tried telling me that even though I had spoke to someone on the phone confirming it was okay to use my mother's card for anything regarding the room he could not help me. After flying 6 hours to get there he was not going to help me? Then another staff member intervened saying all that was needed was an incidence deposit. If that had been explained there would not have been an issue. The room had a stained comforter, black hair on the sheets and poor lighting. The floor also leaked by the sink and the door every time I took a shower. For the price of the room I was thoroughly disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: How dirty the bedding looked
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Great place for good price
review.reviewText: A great place to stay for a good price. Love having a fridge in the room! Staff very helpful. If you want trendy, you might prefer somewhere else, but I will come back!

review.title: Great access to shopping and public transportation
review.reviewText: I thought the hotel was great. It served our purposes for a short two night stay and I enjoyed walking around the area surrounding it. May not be the best place for a family since it's right in the middle of the bustling city so it's not a quiet place. Great access to the subway, bus system, cable cars, and subway. The restaurant was AWESOME. The staff was very friendly and helpful in giving us information to get around as tourists. My only complaint is that the showerhead was pretty awful and clogged up, so showers weren't very fun. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family visiting the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Showerhead clogged
review.locationRemarks: AWESOME for experiencing the city

review.title: October Stay
review.reviewText: Water bottle under the bed, stain on the duvet cover. Also, the mat in the bathtub was coming up and I cut myself on the edge while trying to clean the tub. All staff helpful and friendly except one front desk person on 10/6 evening. When asked about the restaurant hours, I was told, "I don't know, I don't work there." Like I didn't know that. He could have found a more professional way to give me their hours of operation and he should have known those. Then he could have said, 'But depending on the crowd, sometimes they close earlier so I can't guarantee how long much longer they will be serving.' And then he could have given me other options, since there were none available in the rooms which would be helpful. The food btw, was AWFUL...no comparison to Little Joe's who was really missed!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, affordability - although their prices were a little higher than usual especially for what you get.
review.negativeRemarks: Comfort of bed and pillows and cleanliness of room, bathtub needs work.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping, restaurants, Union Square, Amtrak stops, Bart, etc.

review.title: Good for the business traveler
review.reviewText:
The staff was very accommodating for a late, late night check-in. They gave me a 1:00 pm late check-out the next day which really helped for the business appointments I needed to make happen that day and being able to use the room for work during lunch.
The main bad thing was that the bed spread was dirty when I arrived that night. However, the sheets and pillows were all clean. Everything else in the room was good. There was a good desk and chair to work from and even a small refrigerator. I would stay there again and give the house keeping staff another chance, the rest of the staff were excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty Bed Spread/Comforter
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Close to food, public transportation, parking structures, shopping, convention center, entertainment, etc.

review.title: ok place for a night
review.reviewText: staff was very friendly. air conditioning in room was not very good.

review.title: just so so
review.reviewText:
noisy outside. there's a AC ourside the window, on another building's roof. even you close the window, you can hear the sound.

nice location at all.

clean room
review.negativeRemarks: noisy
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Great location, reasonable price
review.reviewText: My family and I spent a few nights at the hotel as I was attending a conference and they toured the city. The location was just a few blocks from the Moscone center and a block from Powell street. The room was small but comfortable. The restaurant didn't have a children's menu, but the food was good.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and price. It was a cute old fashioned sf hotel
review.negativeRemarks: The room was tight for a family, but that is to be expected in an older hotel in the city
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: pleasant surprise
review.reviewText: nice updated hotel. staff were very friendly and helpful. stay was pleasant, room was clean and well maintained. location was superb. valet service was excellent and polite.
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom door would not lock and chain on room door was broken
review.locationRemarks: excellent. close to everything.

review.title: Too noisy
review.reviewText: The staff was really nice and helpful. The problem was the noise due to the old windows in the room. For one night, it was ok. I would recommend to find a room in the back of the hotel. The view is not interesting, but you may have less noise from the street.
review.negativeRemarks: The hairs on the wall in the bathroom and the old windows
review.locationRemarks: Great location, perfect for shopping.

review.title: It was fine
review.reviewText: The room and facilities were all nice, but they can improve a lot with maintenance.
review.locationRemarks: The location was close to almost everything, I was able to walk everywhere with no problems.

review.title: No Bathroom Door!
review.reviewText:
One of the rooms we rented did not have a bathroom door... so for going # 2, you would have to ask your bunk mate to leave the room... I mean, really?!?!

Also, WiFi did not work and their support was incredibly unhelpful.

review.title: well located, clean, safe
review.reviewText: excellent location. shopping and restaurants all within walking distance. very close to public transportation to all the parks, waterfront, financial district, and subway. always felt safe. comfortable beds. my only complaint was poor water pressure in the shower.
review.negativeRemarks: poor water pressure in shower

review.title: Good Value for Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location for walking to many points throughout the city or accessing public transportation. Comfortable stay.

review.title: Perfect Hotel for everyone!
review.reviewText: Friendly & helpful staff and a great location. I have problems walking and this locaton was easy access to the trolley & stores. I had no problems during this trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs new carpet
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to the trolley, restaurants & shopping.

review.title: An oldie but a goodie
review.reviewText: Its an older hotel, but refurbished well. It is certainly not five star, but is comfortable, very close to most amenities and transport. The staff were helpful and obliging. There is no room service, but there are excellent, inexpensive restaurants/bars close by. I would recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to amenities. It was comfortable?
review.negativeRemarks: A little noisy, but well within most people's tolerance levels
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: Cute but not 5 stars yet.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is right in the middle of the action situated right next door to Bloomingdales & dining.

The hotel is a very old yet renovated establishment. The staff are very friendly.They do a good job of keeping the rooms clean, however, I cannot give it a 5 because it is very old & easy to see deferred maintenance.

Keep in mind there is no valet & the attendants at the attached garage are somewhat rude. They even went as far as messing with my car's on board computer. But in all fairness they do not work for the hotel.

My only other gripe is that this area has alot of pan handlers late at night due to the tourism.
review.positiveRemarks:
The convenience to shopping, movies & dining.

Bath & Body works sundries!
review.negativeRemarks: Lots of riff raf in the area.Lack of valet.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: good hotel at a good location, especially for business and shopping. close to sight seeing, too. would suggest to everyone, may be not much fun for kids, though

review.title: anniversary stay
review.reviewText: the hotel is conveniently located to all sites and public transportation. the staff were extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating to special requests. the room was very comfortable with all the amenities you need while traveling. we loved the ability to open the windows and have the cool breeze at night. we would not hesitate to stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: windows that actually open, the staff can't be beat
review.negativeRemarks: a/c not powerful in the room
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to major tourists sites, and public transportation, shopping

review.title: Comfortable hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
An old hotel in a fairly good position close to Union Square.
Rooms are a good size and comfortable.
Nice reasonably priced restaurant on ground floor.
Be sure to get a room at the back without a view as the rooms facing the road are very noisy 24/7.

review.title: Maryann's stay
review.reviewText: I love to stay at the Pickwick, it is convenient and has really good prices.
review.positiveRemarks: The room decor is very cute, i like the Kurig machine in the room, they don't overcharge for the water in room, and my room had a refrigerator
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: I like the location because it is close to mall and main streets for other shopping conveniences.

review.title: Pickwick is a great pick
review.reviewText: Convenient to both congress venue and to places of interest and to area of tourist activity. Covenien for near restaurants. Price was very reasonable. Ride to from airport well covered and reasonably priced

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel but has been maintained wonderfully. It is in a very good location to walk almost everywhere you would want to go.... Would stay here again.

review.title: Its ok
review.reviewText: Given the location and the price, it was fine. The room was not spotless, and the bed was pretty uncomfortable. That said, the staff was nice, and you can't beat the location. I would not want to spend more than one night there.

review.title: Our SF Trip
review.reviewText: The hotel in itself is in great location. Just couple of steps away from Market Street, where you can catch the Mini, and the also the Bart train connection. We used the Mini, which only cost $2 per person to go to Pier 39. But you can easily walk to any point of interest, if you have the stamina to do so to go to Lombard street, as well as Ghirardelli Square. The hotel is right next to the Westfield shopping center, which houses pretty nice food places. If there was only one item I could comment on, would be the internet needs to better. The connection speed is way too slow. Otherwise, the hotel was great, with a beautiful lobby entrance.
review.negativeRemarks: The internet wifi connection is too slow. Needs to improve.
review.locationRemarks: Best location. Walking distance to a lot of point of interest.

review.title: Clean comfortable convenient
review.reviewText: Clean comfortable convenient room for the price, in a great location. The rooms are well-worn (but not disgustingly so), but this is a budget hotel. If you are looking for immaculately decorated rooms, the Marriott and Intercontinental are just around the corner.

review.title: Awesome Value for Money
review.reviewText: Excellent value for money and relitave location to the centre of the city and trams etc. Only issue and this is minor is that teh walls are a little thin so if there are loud people next door can be a bit distracting. Apart form that great stay and very firendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: walls a little thin
review.locationRemarks: excellent. Very short walk to the city (less than 200 meters) and right next door to a massive Westfield shopping centre.

review.title: Mattress Needs Replacement
review.reviewText: Everything was great except for the mattress. It really needed to be replaced.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattress
review.locationRemarks: Pertect for shopping at San Francisco Centre

review.title: Great for the budget minded traveler.
review.reviewText: Overall, this is a great hotel for the price and very close to the Moscone Center. My only complaint is that the bathroom is extremely small and has very little counter space.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and helpful staff! Quiet room.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom, little counter space.
review.locationRemarks: Savy location for the conference attendee.

review.title: Amazing for the price/location
review.reviewText: Fantastic for the price. Friendly staff. Parking was ok, but took forever to get checked in and out.

review.title: excellent value
review.reviewText: a step-down in amenities compared to more expensive nearby hotels, but an excellent value for the $ in an otherwise highly expensive hotel district; it's a third to a half the cost of others nearby and the service is far greater than half that of others nearby
review.negativeRemarks: no in-room safe; fitness center is small - 2 treadmills, one elliptical and one stationary bike (out of order when I was there)
review.locationRemarks: great location: 5 min walk to Moscone; 5 min walk to Powell/Market Street street car

review.title: An underwhelming experience
review.reviewText: Woman who works at front desk was incredibly rude and unhelpful. Bell man was pleasent. Hotel is run down and sort of dirty. Soma restaurant downstairs was tasty.
review.negativeRemarks: staff
review.locationRemarks: ALOT of homeless

review.title: Have Your Own Experience - I was glad I did.
review.reviewText: Other online reviews may have prevented someone from having a great hotel experience - they talked about outside noise and the like. My experience was great! Everyone was very friendly from the front desk to the concierge to the maintenance man who you would see around the hotel doing his repairs. While it is an older hotel I prefer the charm of the large crown moldings and the shabby shiek furnishings; the hotel lobby and mezzanine appear to have had a makeover in the last few years - it was nice. Hallways were kept up and elevators were working well. Our room was just enough space for 1 adult and 2 kids, we didn't need more space because we were busy running from day to night in the city. The restaraunt downstairs was very reasonable and decent in taste. the location was perfect. 1 block to Market Street, Trolly Cars, and 10 min walk to Chinatown. Concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful getting to and from - I found out on my departure that the Pickwick offers shuttle to the airport for a small fee. On our last night there, the hotel fire alarm was set off at 11:29pm - me and the two girls were sleeping and unsure of what was going on, when I realized that we probably SHOULD get up and go downstairs the firemen were there and cleared us within 4 minutes. I never did find out what happened but we were safe and that I'm sure was due to a efficient and quick acting staff. I will definatley stay at the Pickwick again.
review.positiveRemarks: The character of the hallways and rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great Location! Close to Bart, Chinatown, Market Street, Cable Car, Trollys - walking distance to all of these was a breeze.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: Booked a "Run of the house" room. Main room was pretty good, although a bit noisy (but to expected from a second floor room in a busy part of SF). No double glazing in the bathroom (so the bathroom was cold when the weather outside was cold), shower was not great. No hassle from drug users/prostitutes/beggars.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: I was very happy to stay for 4 nights. The first night was little bit uncomfortable. The noise from the street was loud. I asked the stuff to me move me to another room and they did. They were nice and friendly. It is very convenience to many locations and restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the downtown and many centers.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise from the street.
review.locationRemarks: It is very convenience.

review.title: The Perfect Location
review.reviewText: This was the perfect location for us so was perfect for our business travel to SF. We also liked the restaurant and found the rooms to be fine. The first night there were some loud neighbors but they were gone the next night.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: It was a very nice boutique hotel and not a chain. All was good, except the water pressure. The homeless were very pesty. But, that's all around SF.

review.title: Needs a renovation
review.reviewText: Not really satisfied, it was clean, the bathroom was renovated but the rest of the room looks and is old.

review.title: Nice Experience
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a extremely convenient location. The staff was very helpful. The elevators were a little frightening, very slow and I felt sick after riding on them. Other than that i really enjoyed my experience at the Pickwick. The little Italian restaurant had fantastic food at good prices. Overall, this was a excellent value and I would return.

review.title: Older but Nice - BAD WiFi
review.reviewText:
This hotel is clean, convenient, and cheap. I was not bothered by the traffic sounds even though I was streetside. Staff were courteous, especially the housekeepers who hooked me up with a super soft down pillow.

However, if you absolutely must have WiFi that works, this is not the hotel for you. It seems to be very spotty; I would connect then lose connection atleast once every 30 minutes. At times, I could not connect at all. When I took my laptop into the hallway, it would always reconnect - but then drop once I got back into my room. Front desk staff's best solution was for me to use my laptop only in the lobby, which was not, in my opinion, suitable.

review.title: good location, but too loud
review.reviewText: location is excellent and the place was clean and pretty nice but it was just too loud. we kept hearing what i'm guessing were the water pipes throughout the night. it sounded like incessant knocking. i couldn't fall back asleep after i woke up in the middle of the night and i'm usually a decent sleeper.

review.title: Very impressed and happy that I booked
review.reviewText: Great deal for this price point. Not my style of decor, but done really classy. Service was excellent and bathroom was super clean. Best of all, great location -- in the middle of Union Square. Great shopping and restaurants. Also, it's located right by Blue Bottle Cafe. The best coffee shop in town. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Pickwick a bit off the beaten path
review.reviewText: This hotel is old as most are in the area around Market Street. However, it is a few blocks away from the really busy area north of Market Street. So if you like being right in the middle of things you may be disappointed. The location is close to all amenities you need, but not to so chaotic as Union Square. Japanese restaurant next door was really good. There are 2 coffee shops with one block and the mall on market is 2 blocks away. We enjoyed this hotel although the price was steep for what we got. But that was because there were 22,000 extra people in town for the Nike marathon. It was the cheapest hotel closest to Union Square we could find. Hotel is clean, staff was accommodating.

review.title: just basic hotel.
review.reviewText: i can accept but not the best i like for the trip.

review.title: Comfortable Beds!!!
review.reviewText: This funky hotel fit my needs to a tee! Excellent night's sleep, convenient location for my needs...and the price was right.

review.title: Good Price and Clean in Union Square
review.reviewText: Clean hotel. Best deal in the area.

review.title: Nice location, charming hotel
review.reviewText: We stay in the Union Square/Shopping center area of SF often and we try different hotels each time. The Pickwick was a good choice location wise - we go on Amtrak and it's right around the corner from the Amtrak bus stop at the Westfield Shopping center - close to all forms of transportation for getting around the city. The Hotel is charming, very old and quaint, the room was cute and the bed comfortable. Our room was on the outside corner of the building so we had a bit more NOISE than usual (trash cans/glass being emptied at 2 am, shouting and of course traffic. Had a noisy room neighbor but the gracious staff took care of that with a phone call. The SOMA Restaurant in the hotel was delightful for dinner! EXCELLENT food and good service. One of the best dinners I've ever had in SF. It was their first night open for dinner and it was outstanding. YUM - and no $$$-ier than anywhere else. I would stay again but I'd be chosy about the room location. The price was right but I'd like more sleep! But noice can be a problem at ANY of these busy area hotels.

review.title: Great location but uncomfortable bed
review.reviewText: Nice location, near Union Square, BART and the cable cars. But the hotel is badly in need of updating, it has a shabby charm, but needs some brightening up. And the bed was very uncomfortable, hard and only 2 pillows on the King bed. Overall okay, but wouldn't stay there again.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Kind of A Dump

review.title: Small room, small bath, noise,
review.reviewText: Small room, small bath, noise,weak wifi,nothing is satisfied for room, except bed is ok.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Its location and facilities are good.

review.title: It was sufficient, but I am glad that I did not bring my wife
review.reviewText:
The neighborhood is dirty and with a lot of transients asking for handouts and sleeping on the sidewalks. The hotel is worn but charming. Bathroom was sufficient with updated marble, closet smelled like urine, desk area was workable, lighting was almost non existent, decor was charming with the exception of the paint touch ups being an off shade to the original color and the carpet was very worn. Elevator worked well but was very worn.

It reminded me of hotels in Paris, France, but without the ambiance.

Overnight parking was expensive and my car was returned with a ding which seems to be the norm for San Francisco parking garages.

review.title: Lovely older hotel
review.reviewText: Pickwick is a lovely older hotel that we really enjoyed staying in.

review.title: Pickwick Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a lovely, very old hotel with tons of charm. Great, friendly staff who can't do enough to make one comfortable. Great neighborhood surrounded by lots of cafes for all meals. Hotel is across the street from the old US Mint and the San Francisco Chronicle newspaper. Hotel is around the corner from a great shopping mall that includes Bloomingdales. If you keep walking you come to an area with a very old Catholic church (1865), a Jewish museum, and across the street a huge park with a fountain memorial to MLK. That park crosses a main road where you find a 100 year old carousal that still works and a children's toy store and park. A fantastic find.

review.title: Pickwick Hotel is my pick in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, not far from downtown or the BART/Muni transportation or Cable Car routes. Walking distance to many shops, eateries, areas of town such as Chinatown, Little Italy Hope to return there someday. One thing amiss was the trash pick up in the alley outside my windows at 3:30AM, once I knew about it, I slept through most mornings after initial wakeup until my alarm.

review.title: Barely adequate
review.reviewText: Barely adequate

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean the rooms were also well kept and the staff was freindly helpful and courteous. Reading some reviews before i travelled made me kind of apprehensive about what i would ind there but i was pleasantly surprised about the cleanliness and ambience of the room. Some outer windows did not close properly but we were not in danger of any one entering as we were on the 4th floor. If persons will get the room that i had i would reccommend this hotel to my frinds. also it was close to shopping and to the convention center and sightseeing bus tours etc.

review.title: Three stars in fantasy land only
review.reviewText: If this hotel is 3 stars, then the scale must start at three. Poor maintenance, poor customer service, loud streets, or basically not a place anyone could ever recommend to anyone. So glad I only booked one night; how does Expedia rate hotels?

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Check-in at the Pickwick was easy, but when I went up to my room, the housekeeper was in my room on her cell phone, with her housekeeping cart blocking my door. I announced myself and asked if I could get into my room. Without hanging up the phone, she left the room but didn't move her cart, so I could not enter with my bags. When I asked her to move her cart, she scowled at me. The room was stifling hot, and the a/c unit was out of order. The front desk had it repaired while I was out, which was appreciated. The room was shabby and small, and I was generally unimpressed given the price point of the hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to go back! Perfect Location!
review.reviewText: Traveling with my wife and (3) kids. Hotel was conveniently located in downtown S.F. We really enjoyed are stay there. Access to Union Square as well as the other many things around Market Street. The staff were polite, and we will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Although, the hotel is in need of remodeling, the location made my stay worthwhile. I was disappointed with the amount of time it took to check in!

review.title: Upscale thrifty hotel
review.reviewText: A real Hotel with a semi-classic feel. Very friendly and congenial Staff. We are going to use their facility again.

review.title: Pick Pickwick for Moscone
review.reviewText:
Right across from the old US Mint, which is kind of cool. Unfortunately, it's right next door to Chinese Restaurant and the smell from the kitchen permeated all facets of the hotel. Poor water pressure and the lack of a thermostat added to my discomfort. The sex toy store across the street added 'ambiance.' The homeless were pretty aggressive on Market Street, but didn't seem to leak the down the block and a half to the hotel.

The staff, however, was fantastic. Very nice. Very accomodating. I needed a cab to the airport @ 4:00 AM and it was there, as requested.

I highly recommend the Italian restaurant attached to the hotel ... Little John's (maybe Little Joe's). Great breakfasts and dinners.

If you are travelling for business in SF, especially for things in Moscone, this is an OK place to stay.

review.title: Nice, clean, convenient, quiet room for a great price.
review.reviewText: We arrived early and were able to have our room right away. Friendly, helpful staff. Nice restaurant attached and more nearby. Very convenient for BART, buses, Moscone, MOMA, Union Square. Clean, not large, comfortable beds, TV. Quiet. We would happily book there again.

review.title: Excellent location, big rooms
review.reviewText: Excellent location, big rooms

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText:
The Pickwick is located close to the Westfield Shopping center, Moscone Convention center and Market Street. It is an easy walk to just about any thing a traveller on a budget would need. The restaurants in the area are OK, and reasonably priced.

The hotel is clean, and the staff are very helpful. Our room overlooked 5th street and it was a little noisy from time to time with emergency vehicles passing by.

You are close to Muni transportation as well as BART making it easy to get around the area.

review.title: Great Location for a San Francisco visit
review.reviewText:
The Pickwick is a great location if you're using public transportation to get around the city. It is accessible to all major bus, trolley, cable cars and BART routes. I got everywhere I needed to go in 30 minutes.

Enjoyed the in-house Italian restaurant and bar; open late and good service.

Well situated to restaurants, a mall, and movie theaters as well as the major cultural attractions.

I was not impressed with the condom wrapper and used condom I found under my bed when I checked before leaving. Just hope it was there when I checked in. The doorman also did not have my promised cab at 5:15 am, (it had been promised the night before)but he did go out and hail one for me.

I'd stay there again, if by myself, but not sure I'd bring the family or other business colleagues.

review.title: Cute hotel--great location
review.reviewText: It is a historic hotel that is pretty well maintained (really clean, just a little worn). It is not a new, high-end hotel--but you are crazy if you expect that at this price. I've stayed at the Fairmont in the past, and I can't say my experience was commensurate with the price, as compared to my experience at the Pickwick. We loved the room, which was tastefully decorated (the photos on the website are surprisingly accurrate), if a bit small. I have to imagine, however, that it might be a little noisy in the summer if other reviews are right re airconditioning, i.e. requiring open windows. We had no real problems with noise (well, not much of a problem) or climate control during Christmas/New Year's. The location just can't be beat! Assuming you are healthy, you can walk most places. Otherwise, the trolley is about 2 blocks away. One caveat: if you are absolutely phobic about the homeless, go ahead and spring for the hotel in Nob Hill, but NO hotel in this area will insulate you from that presence. It's part of being in a city.

review.title: Great deal
review.reviewText:
We booked from the airport after getting rerouted to FO from Boston during the post-Christmas blizzard and failing to get to LAX as planned for a connection to Hawaii. This was one of those no-name take-a-chance bookings through Expedia and it was way better than anything we'd expected for a bargain basement rate. We'd go back at full fare any time.

The staff were extremely personable and attentive, the room was clean, well-furnished and plenty large while retaining an old city character. The bed was particularly good and the location was excellent re access to Union Square, the BART, restaurants, etc. The only downside is the neighborhood, which gets a bit dicey after dark (as does much of the downtown), but we walked and had no discomfort.

Our stay there ended up being an unexpected extra on a vacation that had looked quite threatened the day before due to flight cancellations. This was a holiday in its own right.

review.title: The best location!
review.reviewText:
VERY convenient location!
Hotel is quite old but clean. All you would like to do/see is within walking distance.
Restrooms are smaller than I am used to, but pretty clean.

review.title: Not impressed!
review.reviewText: The corridor was smelly and the rooms were quite cold. Had constant trouble to access wireless in my room and lobby as well.

review.title: A shanty in a great location if you're going to a convention
review.reviewText:
