The general condition of the hotel is very run down. The walls are dinged and scrapped up as if every hallway is a service entry to a loading dock.

The room... cramped. The fridge... very loud. The internet... only wireless is available. However, they will continue to install router after router, then move you to another floor, then install another round of routers before they admit they don't know what they have.

That said, the staff was pleasant. The location if you are attending a convention at Moscone Center is great.

review.title: Pretty Shabby
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old - which isn't necessarily a bad thing - but it's not been very well maintained. The carpets are old, the walls need painting/repairs, and it has a musty smell to it. The room I had was so small I could barely pull the desk chair out before it hit the bed. The TV was out of the 80's and only had 10 channels on it. The location is close to the Moscone Center though - which was good. For the price, there are a lot better options in the area.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Overall, a very good experience. Close to everything.

review.title: Get the room with King size bed
review.reviewText: All I can say is, get the room with king size bed, because the room with two double-size bed was just horrible.

review.title: Best relation between price and service ¡¡
review.reviewText: very good location, confortables rooms, , I will recommend it ¡¡

review.title: Great place for NWM participants
review.reviewText: The attached bar was a little slow on service to start, but that's my only service complaint. The bathroom was tiny, and a little different, but I am learning that most hotels, especially the boutique ones, in older buildings in San Francisco are going to be different from the mainstream, chain hotels that are in newly built strucutres. Good character and perfect location for Union Square, without the higher prices.

review.title: Great place for Giants games
review.reviewText: We walked to AT&T Park for the game and it was a short walk.

review.title: Old hotel but great location!
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was good and I would stay there again - b/c the location is great. Some of the downsides were: the bathroom was really small and walls of the rooms were thinner than normal.. The toilets were kind of old.. there was no remote control for the TV (or we couldn't find it) and there is no room service at the hotel.. but other than that, the location was perfect, the room was cute and the service was good (could use an extra person at the front desk though).

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel has a very good location close to the convention center the staff freindly but the room is very small and the hotel is very old need renovation the parking very expensive

review.title: OK for what it was
review.reviewText:
PROs:Great location, friendly staff, clean room, bed comfortable, plenty of hot water etc., modest price.

CONS: If central A/C was working I couldn't tell. The brief hot spell abated enough in the evening that this was only a slight inconvenience. No dresser in room - side tables were only drawers available. TV was a very old crt with poor picture and few channels. Noisy due to second floor location, but street noise abated early enough for a good night's sleep.

I had a run-the-house room (basically, whatever they have available) in conjunction with my airline ticket, so I didn't expect the room to resemble the ones shown on the web site. It didn't.

After a number of trips to San Francisco over the years, I've concluded that economy price (for SF) rooms are perfectly matched to tourist class airline service. It's sad that hotel owners and managers don't take a little more pride in their establishments, at least to the extent that they make sure that everything works properly, even in their least expensive rooms. Overall, the Pickwick was about what I expected - a decent, reasonably priced accommodation in an excellent location. If I stay there again though, I'll save up my pennies and go for something above run-of-the-house.

review.title: A great value for the location.
review.reviewText: The Pickwick is an affordable, clean & well maintained hotel. I have sent my staff their for the past 3 years and will keep on doing so, they have no complaints about the hotel, except they would like to see a desk or table the next time they stay. The service is always consistent. The location is perfect for walking to the Moscone Center, however the area is a little sketchy.

review.title: Never stay at the Pickwick! Bad Bad Bad
review.reviewText:
From the outside the Pickwick hotel looks a little beat up. From the lobby you start to think maybe you were wrong and this hotel isn't so bad. Then you get to your room. Not exactly a 3 star hotel! My hotel door would only open half way so i had to slide my bag into the room. Upon entering the room i proceeded to laugh at how many smudge/gum marks were on the floor. I counted 11. Maybe there was more. The decoration was sad and blah. The windows were old and did not block any of the outside noice. I would never recommend this hotel. Not even to my worst enemy.

Only good things are the location and the hot water was quick when you needed to take a shower.

Do not say here.

I am really dissappointed with expedia for stating this hotel is a 3 star. Not even close.

review.title: Decent Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: Decent Hotel for the price, good location. Hotel staff was very friendly.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Very small room. Old hotel and it showed in the walls. Chip marks, poor paint job etc.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice location close to Market Street and many activities. Street noise can be a problem, but earplugs will solve that issue. Otherwise, I've stayed there several times and will be back.

review.title: noting special, except the location!
review.reviewText:
It was not a good hotel. WiFi didn't work in room and I had to went in lobby.
They should renovate this hotel to attract more guests.

review.title: Affordable Quality in SOMA
review.reviewText: Hotel Pickwick is an older building that could probably use a fresh coat of paint, but the amenities were very good. The bed was huge and comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and with decent water pressure. The maid service was very good. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. I'll definitely stay there again when I visit SF.

review.title: Stay Elsewhere!
review.reviewText: My first impression of the hotel was a disinterested and hurried desk person who barely strung two words together. Unfortunately, things went downhill from here. Once I made my way to my room, I discovered that the "run of the house" rooms were more like closets with beds in them than actual hotel rooms. The tiny, cramped quarters included old, battered furniture; frayed, stained carpeting and decor that resembled something along the lines of "Victorian garage sale." If this weren't bad enough, when I finally arrived back in my room later that night, exhausted and ready to take a shower and go to bed, I discovered that my hot water didn't work in my shower (but it worked in the sink). It was explained to me that the hotel is on one boiler and, when they're full, the hot water sometimes runs out and that it should be back within 10 minutes. When I explained that it worked fine in my sink, they continued to debate before finally sending someone up to verify that I, indeed, the shower didn't have any hot water. They eventually (about an hour later) moved me to another room (closet) at the opposite end of the hall where the hot water worked in both the shower and the sink...imagine that. Other than the pleasant bellman, this hotel was terrible from top to bottom. If you're used to Motel 6, then this might suffice, but if you're looking for something clean and comfortable with even a touch of refinement, you're barking up the wrong tree here.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: Nothing special but decent and great location

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: Convenient location for downtown shopping and business. Neighborhood is much quieter than area around Union Square. Located one block from BART MUNI and Cablecar transportation.

review.title: Shoddily maintained rooms, poor front desk service.
review.reviewText: The phone didn't work, it was loud (even though I requested a quiet room), the light at the bedside didn't work, the battery on the remote was dead. One of the windows didn't lock properly and it was possible to climb from one room to another and get in through the window. The lighted name out front was not completely lit up - this is an indication of the overall quality of the hotel. The rooms were dingy and poorly maintained. The concierge was the one highlight, he was helpful and positive.

review.title: can"t wait to go back!!
review.reviewText: it was fun!!

review.title: Pickwick was a good pick
review.reviewText:
The hotel was in a great location. Close to all transit and shopping. The hotel was about what was expected from reading the reviews on the Expedia site. I do feel that many of the more negative reviews were a bit picky. The tub is a bit narrow, the water pressure was not amazing (it was fine though) and the TV was not that great, and the ceiling light had a dim bulb in it (there were plenty of table lamps that lit up the room fine. The are the only things that could have been issues but were very minor. Everything else about our stay was great. We were able to check in early, the room was overall good (not amazing but fine). The cafe a couple of doors down has excellent food for reasonable prices too.
No this was not the best hotel i've ever stayed in, but at the same time it was totally fine and we enjoyed our stay. i will stay here again on my next trip with no hesitation.

review.title: Good value hotel
review.reviewText: The mattress was a little flat and the air conditioner didn't work very well. The ac was only needed when the sun hit the windows. They charge $30 some for parking which is not clear on their website.

review.title: An old, out dated hotel
review.reviewText: You can get a better, updated hotel for the same price. I chose this one because I needed two adjoining with a fridge ( have a 14 month old baby ). Area was ok ,bordering on a run down section of town (lot of bums) but that's most US downtown areas. A few streets north would have been better. Biggest beef is with the conditions of the room. They need updating badly. I made a bad last minute choice that my wife did not let me forget for a while.

review.title: Great location,
review.reviewText:
My family and I went to San Francisco for 4 days last november and this hotel was very confortable (a little noisy), people in reception desk was very kind.
The location is great, near to the cable car terminal, bloomingdales, Nordstrom, etc.
I love it, and I´ll be back in another opportunity to this hotel.

P.S. The city is so GREAT.

review.title: "The Shining"
review.reviewText: This hotel is very old. It's like out of a horror movie, very creepy. The lobby was nice but once you get on the elevator and walk down the halls, it can raise the hairs on your neck. The bed was very uncomforable, it had a huge dip in the middle. I checked in very late at night, the staff did not have my reservation under the correct name and took awhile trying to locate my reservation. The front desk agent seemed almost annoyed that I checked in late. The room rate was inexpensive given it's right in the heart of downtown SF, so I got what I payed for. If you're in town for just a night and don't mind an old hotel with a lumpy old bed then this is your place.

review.title: it´s ok
review.reviewText: Nice to go to alcatraz island

review.title: ~Halloween trip~
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location, went for halloween walking distance from clubs/bars.

review.title: Pickwick Hotel
review.reviewText: The the hotel was very old, not updated, our rooms were very dirty, the toilets wouldn't flush, the lighting was very dim, the windows had no screens and so on. The staff was very friendly and security seemed okay. We ahd 4 rooms. Three of them were the same condition. The fourth was a little better than the other three.

review.title: Filthy bedding.
review.reviewText: The bedding was absolutely disgusting. Some of the stains were clearly fresh but the bedding had clearly not been cleaned for a long, long time. This ruined my stay at this hotel. I would never stay there again, ever.

review.title: Great location with nothing else to offer.
review.reviewText: Great location and quaint lobby. Room dingy with old lip balm and candy bar behind heater unit. Huge cabinet took up much of floor space and held a very small TV which received no local stations. Louver door to bathroom fell off and appeared to have been installed by a person who failed high school shop. It was a louvered door because the sink was in the way of a normal door.

review.title: customer service didnt meet my expectation
review.reviewText: besides the fact that the quality of the hotel and the rooms are not that great, the customer service didnt meet my expectation either. We asked to check in an hour earlier than their usual check-in time and they didn't even pretend to do their best to accommodate that for me.

review.title: Beautiful!
review.reviewText: I have lived in the Bay Area my whole life but when I stayed at the Pickwick it was like traveling to a different place in time! I loved every minute of it. The staff was very considerate about the Do Not Disturb sign, they were quiet until it was check out time. So wonderful after a late night of work. The hotel was also accomidating to the request for early check in. It made it so much easier to be able to rest between meetings.

review.title: A
review.reviewText: The elevator service was the best, the bathroom was the smallest I have seen, the bathroom door needed a dose of WD-40, the lights in the room were too dim to read, the rates for Sat and Sunday were unreasonable, the location was great, The TV was out the first day, the other 4 days the TV channels did not include NBC, CNN, Espn,a weather channell.

review.title: Excellent location. The friendliest people.
review.reviewText: We will stay there again. the room was small but adaquate. reasonably furnished and clean. The staff was unbelieveably helpful and friendly. The location was perfect for us.

review.title: Shopping convenience
review.reviewText: My daughter and I used the Pickwick Hotel during a last minute pre-college shopping trip at the City Center Mall. Couldn't be more convenient! Could have been a little cleaner and the hotel is older, with the famous San Francisco small rooms. Bathroom had been remodeled nicely. Staff were pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Great location and clean room
review.reviewText: Good clean hotel, great location central to public transport, shopping and eating places

review.title: Best hotel, Good location
review.reviewText: My next stay in San Fran will be at the Pickwick hotel. Good location (Westfield, Macy's, Bloomingdales, Cable car), very friendly staff, cozy rooms and clean. Def recommended!

review.title: Great location - away from the noise, but close to everything
review.reviewText: SF has loud nightlife! But this hotel was just far enough away to avoid it. However, it was also close enough to jump on the cable cars, ride the subway, or catch the Muni metro system. Hotel is older, but maintained very well. Would stay there again!

review.title: its to out dated need to be remodeled
review.reviewText: needs update ASAP

review.title: Aging gracefully
review.reviewText: The Pickwick has a wonderful location just off Powell and Market, not far from Union Square. The Hotel has seen grander days, but it's an excellent lower-cost alternative to the Hilton, Hotel Nico, and the other top dollar places in the same neighborhood.

review.title: DON'T GO TO THIS HOTEL
review.reviewText: My wife and I with a 3-yr-old daughter reserved a king size bed thru expedia 2 months ago before the trip, but when we checked in, the front desk could only give us a queen size, saying that all the kings were locked and would't give us any other options. we had to stay in that tiny rm for 2 nights. It was a terrible experience in PICKWICK, I wouldn't stay there any more.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Perfect location

review.title: Take a Step Back in Time
review.reviewText: History buffs will appreciate the Hotel Pickwick, as a stay at this mausoleum is akin to a trip to an antebellum brothel. Heavy, Victorian curtains not only cover the windows but line every corridor, and the room was as musty and stale smelling as any room I've ever been in. The bed linens were old and worn, the paint was literally peeling off the walls, and the desk chair looked like it had been pulled from the local dump . . . by President Andrew Jackson. I don't know which room they used for the photos now posted on the expedia website, but it's got to be a hundred years ahead of the dumpy room I was assigned. Stay away.

review.title: reasonable
review.reviewText: This hotel served its purpose - relatively inexpensive, and very conveniently located right next to Powell subway station. The rooms were simple but reasonably clean. Overall, this is a reasonable hotel.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: I asked for a refrigerator in the room, and after the 3rd time trying they say that they run out. I paid for the parking and when I came back to the hotel about 1 am the gage was locked and the valet guy was hanging out in the lobby.

review.title: Good value near Marriot
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Pickwick while attending a conference at the Marriot. It was less than half the price of a room in the Marriot and a short walk away. Rooms show some age and are smaller than your average hotel room, but I thought it was very comfortable overall. The beds were nice, the room smelled fresh and there was decent temperature control and windows that you can open for fresh air. The staff was way more competent and friendly than I have come to expect.

review.title: Value and Proximity
review.reviewText: It is an old hotel. The rooms are small. It was a good deal and it is in a great spot. We brought earplugs for city noise. Otherwise fine hotel.

review.title: Nice Hotel, but had issues
review.reviewText: During our stay at the Pickwick Hotel, the fire alarm went off at 2:22 a.m. After evacuating the hotel, we were sent back to our rooms with the statement "the fires out" after about 20 minutes. Upon returning to our room and attempting to sleep, the fire alarm continued to go off, but for about 5-10 seconds each time. Upon checking out the next morning, no mention was made of the evacuation and no apologies were tendered. Service level at a hotel of this caliber should have informed us of the issue and offered some sort of discount. We will NOT be staying here again.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel was location; perfectly situated on the edge of Market street, a short 2 min walk to the BART and Cable Car stop. Staff were attentive, and friendly. Rooms were comfortable if a tad cramped (would have been better without the huge TV cabinet), but otherwise perfectly acceptable and good value for money.

review.title: Small but great find
review.reviewText: Beds are super comfy with down pillows and covers. Small but in SF dont expect to spend much time indoors. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: very good location (2 minutes from BART station), very good standard for that price, clean however quite small bathroom. Friendly staff. Definitelly worth to be considered.

review.title: Older hotel, but well kept.
review.reviewText: Although the hotel is considerably older, the renovations that have been done are excellent. The interior of the hotel is very clean and spacious. Our room was average sized, and had very comfortable beds. The locations of the Hotel is very convenient. Lots of shopping and recreational activities nearby. The hotel parking is some of the least expensive in the city.

review.title: Really nice experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is really well located. It is just one and a half block from Market Street. The main cable car station is across the street and a lot of shops are very close to the hotel. The BART station es around the corner from this hotel. The Hotel is very clean, the rooms are great but with not much space, but with the necesary to spend great time in the beautiful San Francisco. If i have the opportunity to go again to San Francisco, i will choose again with out no doubt.

review.title: very good!
review.reviewText: PRO: Very good value hotel, excellent location and good price. CONS: no breakfast, only small restaurant on the site but with no buffet for breakfast.

review.title: double room
review.reviewText: the layout of the double room was a little too small for 2 beds.

review.title: Stay for GDC2009
review.reviewText: I'm from Korea with my colleagues. I saw another people from other country as well as mine. The price is reasonable, the location is perfect, and the venue of GDC is just 5-10min walk away. I will stay there if I attend GDC again.

review.title: Great location, bad rooms
review.reviewText: The only thing this hotel had going for it was it's proximity to the convention center - just a short walk. The rooms were tiny. I've literally had bathrooms in other hotels that were bigger than the room I was in. The wifi did not work. I saw gnats in the lobby. I would not recommend this hotel.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Nice Price
review.reviewText: The Pickwick was a very nice place to stay for a reasonable price. Most of the older hotels have small rooms, as does Pickwick. But, it was nicely furnished, quiet and the staff friendly. One nice feature, the garage offers in/out parking, a must have if you bring your car to the city. Not all hotels offer this. My room was on the small side, but then again, so are the rooms at the Sir Francis Drake, and those cost more. Easy walk to Metreon. Super convenient to BART Station. Nice feature, you can walk through the mall if you don't want to be accosted by panhandlers on the street when coming/going to MUNI/BART station. I would stay again.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel to stay at for a weekend in the city. We took Bart in from Pleasanton and got off at Union Square. The hotel was about a block & a half from the station. Worked out great & is right in the middle of everything.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: It is a nice older hotel. Everyone was very friendly, and it is located just a block from a Bart station and next to San Fancisco Center. Do be aware there a quite a few homeless people in the area.

review.title: Good time
review.reviewText: I had a good time at this hotel. They gave me a free upgrade, so I got a really nice room. The only thing I didn't like was the fact that they had charged my credit card (not because of the upgrade), but anyway in the next week they refunded me.

review.title: alright for price
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel location which was near the Convention Center. Hotel staff were not too friendly. The room is very small, but that is expected in SF. I slept very well because of the bed and its accessories.

review.title: Just right
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised with this centrally located hotel. The lobby was understated and inviting. Our room had a quiet elegance.The bed's white linens were a fresh choice. I was delighted by the attention given to the folding of the bathroom's hand towels and paper products;a bow,a rose and a fan.Yeah, the coffee was good. We made use of the office and would have worked out had we known there was a facility.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was perfect because it was right next to union square. The hotel itself was clean but it smelled like an italian restraunt. (it might have only been the room we were in). I would probably stay here again

review.title: caught me by suprise
review.reviewText: The Pickwick isn't so bad if your on a budget. The rooms/bathroom are much smaller then I expected. the bed were comfortable, love the location, but overall I got what I've paid for

review.title: The Pickwick
review.reviewText: Overall the Pickwick was nice. I can honestly say for the most part I enjoyed my stay at the Pickwick Hotel. What I liked most about it was that it is right in the middle of everything. So many things are within walking distance. The fashion district is about 10 steps away (literally) and transportaion/cable cars/ all that good stuff is like 2 minutes walking distance. The staff was really nice and helped us out with everything. The rooms were nice and clean. Pretty quiet hotel which is also good. Only thing I did not like was the $25 dollar parking charge.

review.title: Fantastic Time!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and the staff even better. Very quiet, clean, and convenient to downtown. Our family would definitely recommend it! The underground morning parking attendant was hilarious and should have his own reality show-a real personality and helpful with directions. Much more fun than say a Hilton or one of the bigger hotels.

review.title: hot and noisy, good location.
review.reviewText: Room was hot and there was no temperature control in the room. Also, the room was extremely noisy (noise from outside the hotel as well as other rooms). You can clearly hear the conversation in adjacent rooms. The hotel is well located, clean, and the employees were courteous. Walking distance to many restaurants, stores, etc. Just make sure to bring a good set of earplugs.

review.title: It's OK to stay
review.reviewText: I stayed just one night, and it was ok. The room was a bit small and looked old. But, the location was very convenient for shopping. I got the reservation via online and the price was added up for additional people plus two. Also, I could not reserve the parking from the hotel. So, I had to park in the public parking lot.

review.title: Pickwick in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location and great price. I would definitely go back.

review.title: good, better if you get a special rate
review.reviewText: room was nice, not so large, and small bathroom, not renewed, overall as clean as it should be. TV screen quite old but ok for us. The two "best" from my point of view: a small fridge under the TV really helpful and a free wifi connection.

review.title: not what i expected
review.reviewText: Old room, comforter was old, tv was tiny with horrible reception,parking is too small for hotel I had to wait 10-15 minutes while the valet moved 6 cars to find mine. Lots of street noise! This place was old and dirty. The lobby does not match the rest of the hotel. The lobby is pretty. Good location, but not clean. I would not stay here again.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the stay very much. It was peaceful and although the room was somewhat small, there was plenty of room for my boyfriend and I to be very comfortable. I was excited about the refridgerator under the tv!!!! I will definitely return. It is also very close to lots of stores as well as all different forms of transportation such as the subway. Loved it!!!

review.title: Worst Experience
review.reviewText: Stay away from this place... No wireless connection for whole week!

review.title: Great Value!
review.reviewText: This was a terrific hotel for the price!

review.title: No thank you
review.reviewText: Upon arriving in this historic hotel, my wife and I were not impressed. The personnel were the saving grace for our stay otherwise we would have changed hotels. Problems included: - Internet connectivity (wireless or wired) was unreliable - No light in the closet to find the clothes we'd hung. - Small ridge entering the bathroom caused us to stub our toes several times a day. - Housekeeping entered our room while the 'Do Not Disturb' sign was hung. - Over bleached white sheets and comforter caused me to have an allergic reaction. - One of the two elevators was out of order on the first day of our stay and both elevators on the remaining days did not come when called often taking 5-10 minutes (not including any stops on floors to pickup other passengers).

review.title: I hope this great review doesn't make it hard for me to book a room again!
review.reviewText: The staff was nice. The hotel was nice. The location was PERFECT. However, parking wasn't free and our bathroom had a weird odor that was bearable but lingered for the entire stay, 3 nights and 4 days. It smelled like faint body odor. Also, no smoking throughout the hotel or else they charge you $200. Other than that, the room was really really nice and I would stay there again. Shopping and restaurants were right there, so you don't need a car. You can take a cable car or a double decker bus to Fisherman's Wharf and Chinatown and all that. Overall, I was very satisfied with my stay. I loved San Francisco and didn't want to leave.

review.title: Excellent for our trip.
review.reviewText: It was perfect for us to catch our cruise.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Far a 3 star, nothing fantastic... and on a busy street.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Great location, great value, but very thin walls! You can hear your neighbor on both sides watching tv! That wasn't so great, but no big deal if its just a one or two night stay.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: As expected and advertised; good value from Expedia

review.title: Great Hotel perfect location!*
review.reviewText: The Pickwick is a delightful place to stay, and the rooms are neat and the bed (king sized) was awesome! The tv was not a flatscreen and the alarm clock was older, but I don't use either one so whateve. Everything was nice and clean and pretty. The shower nozzle wasn't full power, but the bathroom was immaculate. One thing that made me like this hotel stay even more was the house keeping lady! She was soooooO sweet and by the time I went to check out she said "but I don't want you to go!!!" Great location, great service and perfect for the money! Cheers*

review.title: Good location, mediocre hotel
review.reviewText: Location of this hotel is great - just a short walk to Union Square with underground parking facilities. Quite cheap. Given the above it's still a reasonable choice for those that (like us) are planning on being busy enough that you aren't going to be spending too much time in your room. The rooms are quite small, it was difficult to get the shower to produce hot water (though it did in the end). Also I'd avoid the italian restaurant. Its outdated and not great food.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great hotel located walking distance to everything! Charming decor and friendly staff. Would recommend to anyone.

review.title: Walking distance from many sights
review.reviewText: Not wanting to get lost in the big city, I chose a place that I could walk to and from the convention center. The Pickwick Hotel was only 2 blocks away. I would stay here again for that specific need. Next time, I will take a pair of ear plugs to cut the noise of trafic.

review.title: nice comfortable basic room
review.reviewText: only disappointment was I reserved a room with two double beds and when we got there, there was only single king beds. Three of us had to share one bed. Otherwise, everything ran smoothly. good location. lots of eating places near by.

review.title: I'll stay again!
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location, clean rooms, windows open a bit for fresh air flow. Fast internet with comfortable working table. Concierge was wonderful with perfect dinning suggestions. One of the most comfortable beds and most important for me was that it's a no smoking hotel!!!!

review.title: Great location and Comfy beds but tired and noisy
review.reviewText: Great SOMA location. Friendly and helpful staff. Hotel shows signs of age...lots of cracks, wear, etc. Location and thin walls/windows results in a VERY noisy stay. Bring earplugs.

review.title: Worked just fine
review.reviewText: The front desk was very friendly. We had a very plesant stay. The rooms are slightly small, but very comfortable and clean.

review.title: Soo Not Worth It
review.reviewText: The rooms were barely cleaned. the sheets I know were not clean or changed after a room cleaning. The service was laxed. They did the minimal possible. For the rediculous price that it was,you can find much beter.

review.title: Nice French Decor, Great Location, All in a Great Deal
review.reviewText: I was impressed how easy it was to get to this charmer of a hotel, right off the Bay Bridge 5th street exit,and only one block to the main downtown shopping mall--perfect! Couldn't have been easier. This older hotel has comfortable beds, small but tasteful bathrooms, and pretty French provincial decor. We booked an on line special and were very pleased with our stay. Lost of guests were from Europe which only added to the charm.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is right in the middle of all the action and the service was great!

review.title: Nice hotel for the money
review.reviewText: The Pickwick was very conveniently located and we enjoyed our stay there very much. The rooms were a bit on the small side but were clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was helpful and we had a great experience with all at the hotel. We'd stay there again.

review.title: Shopping Convenience
review.reviewText: Hotel Service was Good. Condition of Hotel is old but well kept, room was clean. Neighborhood at night is lite but have transients near the hotel. Always have people walking at night, feel somewhat safe. The Pickwick Hotel is around the corner of Nordstrom and the Westfield Shopping Mall very convenient for shoppers.

review.title: It was O.K. for the price and location
review.reviewText: If it wasn't such a great price I wouldn't of even given it a chance. It needs a lot of things repaired, gym equipment and Television had issues and A/C was a little out dated but it was fine for the short time I was there.

review.title: Good location but...
review.reviewText: The Pickwick must have been an SRO in another life. The rooms are tiny and its age and formerly more straitened circumstances show through the hotel veneer. I stayed in a corner room and could hear incredibly loud street noise from BOTH windows--garbage trucks, hoses, street work, etc. Also, after 10 the street fills up with homeless and late-night "business" opportunists. Not fun. If you're on a vacation, with others and plan to spend NO time in the room, then it might be OK, because it is a convenient location. For a business traveler, where you end up spending odd amounts of time in the room-as-office, and/or keep odd hours, I don't recommend it.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at the Pickwick. Last time the room was much larger and the price was much smaller. When I picked up a "clean" glass to have some water, there was already about an inch of water in the glass....a little off-putting. However, the overall cleanliness seemed fine.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: No doubt the room is small, especially for the price, but after walking the one mile from the Caltrain station, it was a welcome sight,especially considering the desk staff let me check in at noon! The room itself is quite charming and looks out across to the Old Mint.The rooms and the bathrooms have recently been updated. Still, the age of evrthing comes through in a very European way. The hotel is on a very busy street, but with the curtains closed, noise is never a problem. Also the BART station is only one block away. I am a frequent traveler and would definitely stay here again, but please note that this is not in any way a luxury hotel.

review.title: great
review.reviewText: We made a mistake when we ordered the room, only booked 2 nights in stead of 3, but there was no problem fixing that the same day as we were supposed to be checked out of the hotel! we very very satisfied

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellently located for all downtom activity. Just one block fron the cable car turnaround and trolley bus. Arrived late afternoon, drop off and parking easy, despite rush hour traffic. We had a room on 5th floor at front of hotel, some street noise at night. Ate at attached italian restaurant, very good service and wonderful homestyle cooked food. Would return.

review.title: Lovely, charming hotel - definitely will return
review.reviewText: We wanted a hotel right downtown, but not too $$$ and found Pickwick - loved it. We walked everywhere from the hotel and the rooms were darling (very small & European). The front desk was helpful and friendly and it was always clean and well cared for. The ambiance was like stepping into the 30s. Really fun and I'd recommend it without hesitation. And wireless too - that's nice!

review.title: Great value for price
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel for the money. The location is a bit out of the way but it is within walking distance of Union Square and taxis were easy to get. There is reasonably priced parking at the hotel. Our room was small but clean and nicely decorated. The bed was great and the bathroom was clean and updated. We would stay here again.

review.title: Good short stay hotel
review.reviewText: Somewhat small rooms and bathroom but adequate for a short stay, especially for the price and only a couple of blocks from Union Square

review.title: Good Location, Poor Ventilation, Reasonable Rates
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel, so the condition is not top notch. The ventilation system of the hotel does not seem to work very well. When I first arrived at the hotel, I could smell the food coming from the lobby restaurant. When I went to my room, the smell of food was there also. I had to ask to switch to another room to avoid the strong smell of food, but I was switched to a smaller room. The location of the hotel is convenient, next to the BART and muni stops. The rates are reasonable. The free wifi is not secured, which makes surfing the web worrisome.

review.title: Gave it one more chance....and was not impressed
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Pickwick three times so far. The first time was ok, second and third time was not so good. I told myself I would be fair and try it one more time. Third times the charm right? Wrong. The rooms are run down, carpet is old, the quilt on out bed was stained the last time I stayed there (in April 2008.) The bathroom was small and clean enough. The room had cracks and stains. The front desk attendent was nice and great location (right across from the mall) but over all the hotel is a dissapointment. I feel lke I gave them a fari cahnce and I don't think i will be back.

review.title: Small, but served it's purpose
review.reviewText: The room was a little small, but it was very clean. The size didn't bother me since I was staying alone. I didn't need a large room. There was a certain level of street noise, but I had no problem sleeping. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay there again.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located in San Francisco. The BART station is one block away and that way you can have easy access to the entire Bay Area. Also there are plenty of places to eat and shop around.The rooms are small but very comfortable, and the staff is very courteous.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Pickwick for New Years Eve, check-in was easy. I arrived early and the room was ready. Room is not large but comfortable,serves a purpose if your plan a night out in the city. Location is perfect for shopping and dining. Little Jo's downstairs is excellent Italian food. Parking is in the same building and easy, I loved this.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was ideal,within walking distance of numerous restaurants,stores and transport.It was clean and had very friendly and helpful staff.The Italian restaurant attached to the hotel was great with good food and excellent service. I would be happy to recommend it to my friends if they wanted to visit San Francisco.

review.title: excellent, great value
review.reviewText: This was a rather impulsive trip - wanting to use my Expedia coupon before it expired, and the rate was reasonable. I also like this location south of Market as opposed to Union Sq. The one negative were the few transients sleeping on the Old Mint opposite the Hotel

review.title: Can't beat the location
review.reviewText: Perfectly located for conventions and for shopping. Small enough to have more intimacy than those super-sized hotels. Great beds and pillows, a rarity for most hotels.

review.title: Great location, Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The Pinwick is in a great location. It's right next to the cable car turn-around, a huge mall and Union Square. We checked in annd went walking around all day long. Had a great time in San Fran! The hotel itself was nice enough. The room was beautifully decorated and clean. The staff was professional and the lobby was pretty. We definately felt that we got our money's worth. Only catch was the $28/night parking fee in the garage below the hotel.

review.title: covenient and moderately priced for Moscone Center
review.reviewText: Very close to the conference center at Moscone, and not badly priced. Good bed and facilities, including free internet. Reasonable quality for the price.

review.title: Would love to go back.
review.reviewText: superb location, friendly and helpful staff and the accommodation was very comfortable.

review.title: nice well decorated but tiny rooms with good beds
review.reviewText: good location, easy bart(light train) ride from airport for $6, tiny rooms but clean with good beds, small fridge, needs toaster or microwave. no pool, workout room just 4 treadmills but open 24 hours, reasonable for the price.

review.title: Crammed room
review.reviewText: Location was good - close to the Powell Station metro. Avoid talking to bums around the metro, they won't leave you alone for a long time. The room was very small, there was no room to put 1 suitcase and open it. Other than that the room and bath were clean, improvements were made, and although it showed cracks and paint peel, it wasn't too bad. The decor was very nice, not overdone. We were in a room ending in -25. That's the smallest of all - even the other rooms with single king bed are bigger. If they tell you you're in a room say 425, ask to switch to another, they are bigger.

review.title: Internet doesn't work!!!!
review.reviewText: I was there for 3 days, and they told me the wireless connection would be resolved by the first night. 3 days later, yep you guessed it, no internet.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This hotel was conveniently located close to the BART station and there is a large shopping center close by. It's an older hotel and the hallways smelled like garlic (there's an Italian Restaurant downstairs) but the room was nicely kept.

review.title: Overall Great stay.
review.reviewText: Overall we liked our stay at the hotel. The parking was a little annoying. We had to wait about 10 minutes while the attendant played tetris with all the cars. Also, we were given a room right on mission street. It was very loud and the room was not as stated as on the website. There was no down comforter or cotton robe. We couldn't sleep so we contacted the night manager and he gave us another room, which was perfect. The bath and body works products in the bathroom was great! We loved the culture of the hotel. The bartender on the Little Joe's was very friendly. Overall the stay was nice. Just leave yourself a little time for the parking attendant to get your car!

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean, comfortable and within walking distance of Market Street and the convention center. It wasn't fancy but I wasn't paying for fancy. I would stay here again in a heart beat. Great value for the money!

review.title: Excellent location and superb value
review.reviewText: I was attending a conference at the Moscone Center (at the intersection of Howard St and 4th St) and the Pickwick Hotel is literally a block away (Mission St and 5th St). Comparing to the other big-chain hotels in the area, Pickwick offers unbeatable value. The location is superb even for those not attending a conference. Just a block away is Market St/Powell St, where one can catch the famous Powell-Hyde cable car, as well as MUNI buses/streetcars to other tourist attractions like Fishermen's Wharf, Ferri Building, and Telegraph Hill. For those who like to shop, Bloomingdale, Macy's, and big name fashion stores like Levi's are only a couple of blocks away. While Pickwick is not the newest hotel (one can see rusted outer windows left over from the old days), it's been renovated sufficiently that everything is up to modern day standards. Their choice of bathroom amenities (Bath & Body Works) pretty much says it all. My GF and I had a great time staying at Pickwick, and it'll be our top choice when we come back to San Francisco in a couple of years.

review.title: Party Central
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was pretty nice. The rooms were fairly small but there were a few cracks in the wall and the ceiling in the bathroom appeared to have suffered some water damage. Considering the age of building, I'm letting to let that slide. There is only so much you can do with such an old building. My only real complaints were that it appeared to be party central. A lot of young crowds in and out of the hotel and towards the evening there were quite a few young adults partying in San Francisco. Perhaps it was the just the wrong weekend to come to SF and the guests were just a little too rowdy. On Sunday morning at 1 am I was rudely awaken by loud and obviously drunk people shouting in the halls completely oblivious to the fact that people might be sleeping. I can't really blame the hotel for their guests, but the walls are paper thin and you hear absolutely everything. I would stay here again, but I would wait for a less crowded time of year.

review.title: Ask for the better room
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby was very nice so when we went to our room we were quite disappointed. It was very small and a bit beat up. The front desk said there was a convention going on and that the hotel is over one hundred years old. But the next night we were moved to a much better room. Although the hotel was old this room was much bigger and nicer. So ask for the better room.

review.title: Pickwick - Great Stay!!!
review.reviewText: Our room wasn't ready when we arrived as the hotel was extremely busy(there were major events taking place in the city). The staff was quite courteous and polite and made it very painless for us to leave our luggage. The bellman took it to our room while we lunched and looked us up in the restaurant to give us our keys. Nice touch! Room was nice and comfortable; location is the best - just steps away from Nordstrom and local transit. We will go back.

review.title: Its near everything!
review.reviewText: I had no idea when I booked this hotel that it was so close to my favorite area of the city-Union Square. I booked it because it was close to the venue I had to be at but it was so nice to be able to just walk to all the restaurants and shops on my down time.

review.title: Nice Visit
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at The Pickwick. The room was clean. We had a pretty nice view. I liked opening the window at night and the free internet access. There was a parking fee, but the attendent was prompt and I never had to wait longer that one minute to get my car. I felt safe in the neighborhood even when walking at night.

review.title: Pick the Pickwick
review.reviewText: I chose the Pickwick for myself and two other travellers based on reviews from Expedia and I wasn't disappointed. The price was great for the location. Despite getting a room on the 2nd Fl, there wasn't much noise. The bed was comfortable and though the room was small it was clean. The mall entrance was just down the street. Location was perfect for visiting Westfield Mall.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: The Pickwick is very conveniently located for access to Market Street and an adjacent multi-floor Westfield shopping center. The trolleys are only two blocks away. Also, AT&T Park is only an easy 25 minute walk. The hotel's staff is very accommodating and friendly. All levels of service were excellent. This is always important in any hotel stay.

review.title: Great hotel for a great price for San francisco
review.reviewText: I would stay at The Pickwick hotel again, it was great value and central location, close to the Westfield shopping centre, cable car turn around, union square, and muni. The room was small, but clean and the staff was friendly. I think it was great value for the money in the heart of the city.

review.title: Excellent experience
review.reviewText: Very clean, nice amenities (including clean, modern work-out room and business center for printing those boarding passes). Right in the middle of everything: cable car turn-around, BART, museums, shopping. Staff was courteous and discrete. Would stay there again.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, and close to Union Sq

review.title: Already planning my next trip
review.reviewText: I always stay here when I come to the city. It's a nice hotel that keeps you right in the middle of all of the excitement. Everything is withi walking distance and the hotel staff are very polite and helpful if you are trying to find something.

review.title: In need of some repair and updating
review.reviewText: The price was right, but the rooms are very small and in disrepair-- the beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean- just needs updating.

review.title: Okay in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Safety issue is the only thing concerned. We couldn't let the window open at night.

review.title: Will come back next time
review.reviewText: Very GOOD location. Closed to bus line, train station, shopping centers, restaurants...

review.title: Great Stay but somewhat noisy
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel and service. the wall are thin though and depending on your neighbors it could be noisy. Maid knocked at the door on Sunday Morning at 8:00am....

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Pickwick is very strategically located in the heart of downtown. It was easy to walk everywhere. The room was clean and the beds extremely comfortable. Simple old world charm with friendly service.

review.title: Quaint, but small
review.reviewText: Nice independent hotel just off Market street with lots of good shoping. Quite a walk to the Wharf and other attractions, but close to some shopping. Hotel is nice; older and somewhat small rooms.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is ideally placed for any visitor wanting to get around SF and see the sights. Located just across from the Old US Mint. The trams and bus services are less than 2 minutes away. Chinatown and Financial District are within an easy walking distance. Hotel clean but fairly small. Rooms are not generous but for the amount of time you spend in the room it was adequate. Many restaurants near by which are inexpensive.

review.title: Good Location. Good Value.
review.reviewText: It is an older SF Hotel. With the given that the rooms are small, the service was unobtrusive, but helpful, and the hotel was very clean. The Little Joe's, the attached restaurant, left something to be desired, but convenient.

review.title: Great Location. Great Value. Historic Charm.
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location at Union Square. Warm decor and upscale small bathroom made stay relaxing. Free wireless internet a plus. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Lots of closet space, but no drawer space.

review.title: Great SF Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent value at The Pickwick. Room has AC and mini fridge. The Bed was comfortable and the room nicely furnished. The location is close to Union Square and all of downtown.

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: the best hotel the service, the ubication all 100% satisfaction my next travel i stay en this hotel.

review.title: Great Location at a Great Price
review.reviewText: We stayed 4 days and enjoyed every minute. The hotel's location was perfect for shopping, dining, and visits to museums, galleries and other places of interest. The room was clean and comfortable; the staff was friendly and helpful and the price was right. We will stay again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel had many conveniences such as an Italian restaurant right in the lobby area, as well as other restaurants within walking distance. Union Station was a quick walk, only one block from the hotel, as was the Moscone Center. Only downsides were: the bed was too soft, and the rooms were not well insulated. We could hear people talking in the next room. Great place to stay if you want to be close to everything.

review.title: Fine, but too little space..
review.reviewText: We travelled two adults and two kids (14 and 9 yrs). We booked a double (two queen bed) room for the four of us based on experience from other US hotels. However even though there were two queen beds, there was no space around these beds. So for four people, the room was simply to cramped. For two it would have been nice and cosy. Otherwise the location is excellent - walking distance to just about everything, or bus/cable car etc just around the corner. It is an excellent base for exploring San Francisco. Staff was friendly and serviceminded.

review.title: May or may not go back
review.reviewText: Strong food smell in the hotel keeps bothering. Good side should be about its location close to place in downtown of SF and beneficial for shopping lovers. Really convenient.

review.title: Good for price
review.reviewText: Decent hotel, in ideal place for shoppping, next to Westfield Mall. Bathroom very small, but overall room was clean and comfortable. However, while included wireless internet was promised, no connectivity in room 234 (told just THAT room, not sure how true that is) so if you really need it, see if you get it when you check in or ask for another room.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Whenever I am in SF I always stay at the Pickwick. It is a nice, very affordable hotel that is close to everything to see and do.

review.title: Well maintained.
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel (70 years) but has been updated with current items that travelers come to expect. Good access to mass transit an shopping. Embarcadaro ten mintues by trolley.

review.title: Downtown SF Convenience
review.reviewText: We wanted a hotel within walking distance of AT&T park, and the Pickwick worked out very well. Our room was small, but clean and the hotel was quiet. Besides AT&T park, the hotel is situated near restaurants, movie theaters, and a large Westfield shopping mall. The parking garage does allow in and out privileges for hotel guests, however BART and muni stations are close by. Leave your car and walk around the city!

review.title: Beds are awesome
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, just do not eat breakfast at the Italian Restaurant in the lobby. Too expensive and not worth it. Within 20 yards of the front door is a nice little breakfast/coffee shop.

review.title: Not really good hotel but convenient location
review.reviewText: At first the room was small, dark, long time to get hot water, no wireless net access. After several complaints, moved up-and-front with bigger, stable LAN-Internet and instant fast hot water.

review.title: impressive
review.reviewText: personnel were so knowledgeable and very helpful.

review.title: Great hotel in fantastic location
review.reviewText: This Hotel is in a really great location. It is right by the cable car/ trams and buses and is ideally located for shopping. (its right next to the Westgate Centre and Bloomingdales) The staff were really friendly and the hotel was clean and tidy. If you want to get out and about and see San Francisco this place is great as it has all you need.

review.title: A little gem
review.reviewText: The Pickwick is tucked around the corner from one of the busiest intersections in SF, just a short block to major trolley, bus, and cable car service. The staff was exceptional -- competent, caring, professional at all times. It was a delightful stay.

review.title: It is a good budget hotel.
review.reviewText: I would stay there again.

review.title: Was pretty nice
review.reviewText: The hotel is old, but in good shape. The rooms are small and could be cleaner but overall a nice room.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Rooms smaller than appeared on internet review. Would choose this hotel again, but would ask for room nearer street side. Very noisy every night when emptying trash bins and recyclables.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Solid service and room. Good option in the downtown

review.title: Well satisfied
review.reviewText: Very comfortable. All staff very friendly and helpful

review.title: Imagination fell short, but Loved it!
review.reviewText: Entering the hotel room, I realized it was very tiny because the king-sized bed took up much of the space and the bathroom is small. But, the best thing about the hotel is its convenience to the cable cars, buses, and metro system- gets you everywhere you need to go in SF. The location is like living at NYC's 5th Avenue. You'll fall in love with Pickwick like I did, if you give it a chance. Don't mind the tight quarters, view it as quaint and cozy.

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: The Hotel is old and the rooms are small. It is as clean as you can get old places. They did have AC. And they are close to the Trolley. The room was not very sound proof and there was no view. If you are not planning to spend time in the hotel it is a good place to stay.

review.title: comfortabl and convenient
review.reviewText: nice pillow top king bed windows that actually open to allow fressh air in room goos ac and heat as needed br small but adequate great location 2 blck off market easy walk to shopping,dining,transportation never took our car out of the garage parking availbale at $28 per night

review.title: Safe and Clean
review.reviewText: If you are traveling alone this is a safe hotel, premiere location in Union Square and clean.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: My husband and I tend to stay at the Pickwick every time we go to San Francisco. We love the location (Union Square) and the price is right for this quality hotel.

review.title: Werid Vibe
review.reviewText: The place was straight out of the shining and on top of it, tiny. The room is smaller than a standard jail size, and although a king bed was advertised and pretty sweet, it also took up 80% of the room. On top of the small room and not too kind staff, you pay $28!!!! a day just for parking on top of your hotel rate. Stay Away from the Pickwick.

review.title: Not so sure
review.reviewText: For a budget hotel we weren't expecting something luxurious, but there was a pungent odor we couldn't quite identify. The room was not really dirty, but not spic and span. I was completely turned off however, when I woke up the next morning with a spider bite on my chest. Would search for a better smelling bugless "budget" hotel next time.

review.title: Very nice room. Staff quite helpful.
review.reviewText: Yes, the hotel is in the downtown area, so it is somewhat noisy. Even 6 floors up there was alot of street noise. We still slept fine, as the room was clean and comfortable. The bellman was very helpful as were the daytime front desk staff.

review.title: Disatisfied
review.reviewText: The hotel was run down looking. Stains on the walls in the hallway. Stains on the carpets in the hallway and in the rooms. Stains on the walls in the room. The rooms and bathrooms are extremely small. They have ancient small-sized tv's. You can hear the elevator going up and down from the room. You can hear people urinating in the room above you. You can hear everything from inside the room, people talking in the hallway and in the other rooms. The room had 2 double beds, but only 3 full sized towels. The view from the window was horrible...just a big wall. I won't be staying here again.

review.title: Downtown accomodations with some old-time charm
review.reviewText: My fiance and I stayed here for a weekend getaway, and it was just what we were looking for. The room was pretty small, but decorated in an old Victorian style. There is artwork hung up around the room. It's in an excellent location - one block from the BART/MUNI, right next to the shopping district, and a short walk from CalTrain (for those that care about that). Parking is $30 a day for in-and-out in the valet lot below the hotel. That seems to be a pretty reasonable rate given the neighborhood.

review.title: Free broadband but slamming doors
review.reviewText: Plus: Free broadband, and a power strip attached to the side of the desk. Minus: The doors slam. I woke up repeatedly every night. The room was small but not overly so.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: comfortable botique hotel. very helpful staff

review.title: Loved this Hotel
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel! It was very close to lots of cool things in San Francisco, including the Moscone Center. The rooms were neat and the staff was very helpful and nice. I loved my comfy bed. The only downside was that my shower was very weak and didn't provide much water. All in all, I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: going back soon
review.reviewText: the hotel is very cute. its clean and the staff is friendly. the location is a block from the shopping center, and 2 from union square. 2 blocks from the theater district. i loved it, and im going to back again.

review.title: room was a little cramped but comfortable always cleaned pomptly
review.reviewText: As a base to tour San Francisco was good perfect location for Mosconi Center activities

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText: Very nice and clean, one block from powell station!

review.title: Noise
review.reviewText: We had a outside room, so sleeping was very difficult.

review.title: Nice room
review.reviewText: I thought this was a really nice hotel, and it was perfectly located. I was in town for a convention at the Moscone Center. It's just a block or so away from the end of the cable car line as well. There was some street noise, but it wasn't awful.

review.title: Rough but convenient
review.reviewText: The location was good for attending a conference at the Moscone Center, but the rooms are definitely rough.

review.title: Service at Front desk is not good at all
review.reviewText: The service at front desk was not pleasant. Had to go inside to get bell hop who was standing there looking at us.

review.title: Pickwick Review
review.reviewText: The hotel location for my trip was perfect. The hotel is very close to the Moscone Center. I'm not a well seasoned traveler but I felt the price was a bit above the quality, however the service was great, the room was clean, and I had no problems during my stay. All that being said, I will probably stay there again.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location south of Union Square. My only complaint was our room was a little noise due to proximaty to the ice machine and other guests.

review.title: affordable, but like the saying goes, you get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: hotel staff was great! The carpets and upholstery inside my room were badly stained, and the bathroom was far less accommodating than advertised.

review.title: A good hotel
review.reviewText: It's a good hotel with nice and friendly people.

review.title: Parikng Charges extras
review.reviewText: The thing not covered/mentioned is the cost of parking. If you have a car, there is a full-day parking charge of about $30 (after including taxes).

review.title: Nice place to sleep.
review.reviewText: Cute rooms. Really comfortable beds. Great shopping nearby.

review.title: Great location but expensive parking
review.reviewText: Room was adequate. Great location right between Nordstrom's and Bloomingdale's, with the trolley a block or two away. The rooms were Small with dated carpet, and the parking was pricey.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed the historic feel with the modern day upgrades.

review.title: Good clean hotel great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and rooms were well kept though slightly small. The staff was extremely friendly. Vallet parking under the hotel for good rate.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: this hotel is very classic. the location is perfect. very close with the sf shopping centre. the people are very nice also.

review.title: Excellent value with character and facilities
review.reviewText: I was perfectly happy with this inexpensive hotel. Great position near Union Sq Westfield, helpful staff. The room was very cosy and clean (although slightly cheesey french provincial decor). For the money I would definately reccommend this hotel. Only downfall - no room service and no in house rest. Gym reasonable. Internet access. Excellent position for shopping.

review.title: Pretty Good Deal for Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Since my company HQ is in the Bay Area, I travel to SF several times a year, and have stayed in the full range of hotels from your bargain flea bags to the most luxurious high rises. I'd put The Pickwick somewhere in the middle. The location is good, as long as you don't mind running in to streetwalkers at night while you're making a burrito run. Rooms are clean, beds are firm, and the water is hot, but my main gripe is a lack of water pressure, rendering the shower to be a mere trickle - at least on the 7th floor where I stayed.

review.title: Nice Conveniently Located Hotel
review.reviewText: Although a bit dated, this hotel was clean and comfortable at a very reasonable price for the area.

review.title: Nice hotel and good location
review.reviewText: I was quite happy with the hotel, although the paint in my room was a bit worn on the edges, until I tried to take a shower in the morning and couldn't get the faucet to work. I'm not sure if it was broken or simply extremely difficult to figure out. I did not have time nor patience to call for a maintenance person so I was disappointed in this aspect of my one night stay. Otherwise, things were great!

review.title: A good hotel conveniently located in downtown San Fran.
review.reviewText: I found Pickwick to be your basic, good, reliable hotel. It supplies all the things you would expect, like free high speed internet access, a helpful concierge, and it has a nice buffet breakfast available at the hotel restuarant (but there was no room service available). There was a lot of noise at night unfortunately, but I attribute that to the location that I needed to be in rather than a problem with the hotel.

review.title: Very pleasant hotel
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Service was top rate and the size fit my tastes. Rooms at the front of the hotel were a bit noisy at night.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Awesome employees, love the Pickwick Cafe, great prices, killer view and well decorated. Thank you for the experience...I'll be back again!

review.title: Wouldnt send my worst enemy here
review.reviewText: Horrible service. The Concierge wouldnt call us a cab. No bellman, The valet lost my keys, the shower pipes sounded like they were going to burst, no shower pressure, small rooms, tv was about 10", no room service. All around nightmare! Horrible horrible hotel!

review.title: Great Hotel with 1 Issue
review.reviewText: Old hotel that has been given a quality makeover. Location of hotel is excellent. 1 Block off of Market St. and near a cable car turnaround. The rooms are spotless clean, beds are comfortable and not caved in from use. Loved the comforter on the bed. Quality of service from hotel staff was very good as well. I have 1 complaint and it is significant. The street noise is pretty bad in the rooms. The windows have the old original windows with some newer modern windows that will slide open. Even the modern windows allow alot of street noise in the room. I was on the 5th floor and you still hear car motors, bus motors, car horns, and an occasional siren. Plan to bring ear plugs or sleep with your head between two very comfortable pillows.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Although the room was well appointed it was extremely small and like the rest of the Hotel it seemed quite tired and in need of some attention.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: The room was pretty, but very small. The hotel is in an excellent location for public transportation to all the main tourist attractions. Good price for SF.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice for the price. It was one of the cheaper hotels in SF but still a very nice establishment. The rooms are small but comfortable, the standard comes with a king size bed, which is nice. Nothing too fancy but a decent place for a nights rest.

review.title: Beautiful & Comfortable - Worth the $
review.reviewText: Beautiful room & bathroom! Very nice amenities & well worth the price for the location. For people who visit SF, please remember that it IS a major city so yes there are parking fees for every garage you use, but there is a public parking facility located across the street from the hotel on Mission. Also, there are homeless living on the street; however, even if you pay more $ for other hotels in the area, they will still be homeless individuals there. Better to stay in a very nice, friendly place (very comfortable beds) which is good for the $ and be able to afford the attractions in the area then spend all of your money on higher-priced, cookie-cutter accomidations. Nice historical property with modern day luxuries!

review.title: Expect checkout delays
review.reviewText: One staffer to handle a roomfull of 11:00 AM Sunday checkouts. Outdated and malfunctioning printers and computers added to the fun. Phones ringing interminably. Irate, late guests. No excuse not to have the front desk fully staffed at a weekend checkout time like that. Otherwise, good value for location with some charm.

review.title: one night
review.reviewText: the hotel is in a great location The front of the hotel is bright at night the back is very dangerous area. The service outstanding I left a pair of Chanel glasses ($350.) and they hold them for me for 2 days. The staff is very attentive and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. I had a big (down goose) King bed. The bathrooms are small but very nice, clean and new. For the price this is a total high class bargain.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location - only steps away from the trolley lines, the BART, the bus, restaurants. only downside is the daily parking fee, but I think that is standard for a downtown hotel. Staff were courteous and helpful. Would recommend.

review.title: Worked well for what I needed
review.reviewText: I was there on business, was not looking for a cushy place but needed a clean, reasonably comfortable, safe hotel with easy access to BART - all this came through quite well. Comfortable beds, helpful staff - really a very satisfactory stay.

review.title: Good hotel in a declining area.
review.reviewText: The Pickwick is a great hotel, but the Union Square area is rapidly declining. It is a fun area to stay in as far as being near to shopping and good restaurants, but it is almost impossible to walk five feet without being approached by panhandlers. I lived in SF in 1997 and I think the panhandling problem in Union Square has increased dramatically since then. Visitors to SF may be better off staying somewhere other than Union Square and only going down there if they want to shop.

review.title: Old hotel but great location
review.reviewText: What you see if what you get in the picture. We would not go back to this hotel but it was in a good location one block away from Union Square within walking distance if you are into shopping. Close to China town but not within walking distance. Not within walking distance Fishermans wharf either. You will have to pay daily parking in the hotel underground lot.

review.title: Great value, great location
review.reviewText: Good hotel, great location, good price

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Pickwick is in a very convenient location--close to the conference centers, cable cars, downtown shopping and Chinatown. Very comforable beds.The room was charmingly decorated but could have offered a bit more space.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: Its a pretty nice hotel, service is OK. Pro's: clean rooms, comfortable beds, good service, excellent location-close to everything. Con's: smelly corridors,very small bathroom, exterior is not very presentable. Overall, I think I would stay there again. It is really underpriced:)

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel has a very good location. Easy to get to just about all of San Fran., if not by walking then by multiple types of transit that is within a block of the hotel. The hotel is old and dated, but has a charm about it and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The beds were very comfortable, even more so then my own.

review.title: Very convenient but very noisy
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel at a very convenient location for meetings in Moscone Convention Centers. At the very first night, we found the fridge was boiling hot and noisy, but the staff changed it to a better one immediately. Several construction works are going on around during the day, and drunken people shouting around during the night. You may need ear plugs to get better sleep. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful.

review.title: Convenient to Convention Center at a great price
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable. Very convenient to the Moscone convention center and Union Square/shopping/dining. Would definately stay here again.

review.title: Nice for the buck
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel for the money. Good location. Very nice service. Needs some painting and better breakfast for the $$.

review.title: diamond in the rough
review.reviewText: dont be decieved by the outside appearance. quite a nice place to stay.

review.title: older hotel but has character
review.reviewText: same as above

review.title: Very convenient location
review.reviewText: The location was very convenient to the convention center, Union Square, shopping, etc. The neighborhood was fine. The staff was friendly and helpful. High-speed internet was free. Our room was small with very little storage space. Overall, it was a very good value.

review.title: Outside of Hotel Dissapointing
review.reviewText: I was dissapointed when we arrived at the hotel because of the the way it looked. However, the inside of the hotel was great and the service of the employees were outstanding. Again,the outside wasn't what I expected and in my opinion needs renovation.

review.title: Mentioned in The Maltese Falcon
review.reviewText: Older hotel (w/history!) convenient to Convention Center, Nordstrom's,cable car, and BART. Not a place to hang out, the room is teeny and annoying there is no drawer space, but suited my purposes. Will stay there again.

review.title: Good location, decent value for the price
review.reviewText: Location very close to the convention centre was convenient for my husband. Close to trolley, BART, buses, and streetcars. OLD hotel, so small rooms, peeling paint, old carpet, that sort of thing. However the room was very clean, and the service in the hotel was very attentive (I asked for extra pillows, hangers and got them in a minute). Concierge and front desk staff very helpful. Decent exercise room.

review.title: Great value and excellent service
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel. It had the amenities of a more expensive hotel for a better value. Close to everything and convenient. Rooms were a little small but they made up for it with comfort and the service was top notch. I would definitely stay here again - very classy.

review.title: Perfect for a Convention Stay
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with this hotel. The staff was very helpful, courteous, and friendly. We were attending a convention at the Moscone Center and the location was just a couple blocks to walk. It was only a block and a half to the cablecar turnaround. The room was kind of small, (no chest of drawers) but decorated nicely, with an early 1900's feel. We had down comforters, a refrigerator, robes, coffee and internet access in the room. This made it very comfortable. The girl at the front desk changed our room to one slightly larger when asked if this was possible. When we checked out I accidentally left my phone charger. I called the next day, and the housekeeping manager had noted that they had found it and would put it into the mail the following day. She was very helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Reasonable but Noisy
review.reviewText: This is a decent hotel, but is really noisy. If you are not used to noise, bring earplugs. The rooms are nice and clean, and the staff is friendly.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The location of Pickwick Hotel is very good and the price is fair

review.title: I'll go back to the Pickwick
review.reviewText: I was on the 6th floor with windows on 5th St. The room was small but comfortable with an old fashioned deep tub in a remodeled bathroom. There was traffic noise that didn't disturb me (it's a city). Very convenient to the convention center, downtown, museums, etc. I like old hotels, dislike motel-type places, can't afford boutique or luxury hotels. The Pickwick was just what I wanted.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean, cheap and in a very good location. The room looked old and the furniture wasn't very nice. However the room was clean, which in my opinion is the most important thing. You can go there if you need to save some money.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: Everything was fine for an older building

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: Good location without all the noise. Clean hotel except the carpet - it needs to be replaced! It's old and dirty looking. I didn't remove my socks at all time since I could not see my feet touches the carpet! Good value overall!

review.title: Good Value & Location
