review.reviewText: I was very pleased with what I received for my stay in the area of cleanliness and location to the things I did during my stay. When I arrived at SFO, I was the first in the shared van to be dropped off, and last to be picked up on the trip to SFO for my return flight - this was a nice plus.

review.title: Very Comfortable Weekend Getaway Hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was very comfortable and it's a great place to stay for a "Weekend Getaway" and also if you are traveling on short business trips. The rooms aren't huge, but they are clean and the bathrooms are clean. (One little minor thing, there was a lipstick stain on one of the glasses in the room, but we just rinsed it off with hot water) The staff was very nice and accomodating. The hotel is near some very nice restaurants and bars and there are a lot of shops nearby.

review.title: A Little Surprise in the Heart of Downtown
review.reviewText: The Pickwick is a very nice hotel. It is very conveniently located near Union Square and within walking distance the major shopping areas, which was great for my wife. The only drawback to this hotel was the street noise, as other reviewers have mentioned. But with all the walking and sightseeing, it shouldn't be a problem because you'll be so darned tired at night.

review.title: strategic position
review.reviewText: very good position, right in front of the old mint, it's very close to market street mall, cable car station and Bart station. Needs some maintenance.

review.title: great value for the money!
review.reviewText: I stayed here with my boyfriend in August for a week and we were highly impressed with the hotel. The room was comfortable for the two of us and the concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful. It is a short walk from Union Square shopping and a load of restaurants, as well as the buses and street and cable cars. I did not mind the bums outside because they would be there no matter where in the Union Square area you stayed. We stayed on the second floor and there were loud sirens overnight but didn't keep me awake. This place is wonderful. I definitely recommend staying here.

review.title: Reasonable, charming hotel
review.reviewText: The Pickwick is in a good, central location, near Market street and shopping, although not in the most trendy of areas. The rooms are comfortable, but small. It's easy to get cabs or public transportation from the hotel, and a large parking garage is across the street on Mission. I would stay here again.

review.title: Will definitely stay at the Pickwick for my next trip to San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The staff were professional and helpful. One housekeeper went the extra mile to find a scale for me to make sure my bags were the proper weight for the airplane guidelines. In my book, she wins the gold star for customer service! And she didn't act as if she expected a tip, like one of the doormen. She got a tip from me anyway!

review.title: Extremely comfortable and supportive bed
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Union Square without paying Union Square prices. It is also within minutes of BART. The staff were professional. No problems with checking in or out.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and clean. We'll certainly stay here again! The Pickwick is located within one block of Noordstrom's, a trolly car stop, MUNI and BART stations and is within walking distance of Union Square.

review.title: Heavenly Bed!
review.reviewText: Lovely king size bed with superior linens and mattress - did not want to get up in the morning! Only negative is that the rooms are very very tiny, inadequate closet and drawer space. We lived out of our suitcases (using up valuable floor space).

review.title: good value hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the economy category but is very central to downtown SF. Rooms are small but for the price and locality, worthwhile staying at. We were with two of our children and they were concerned at the number of vagrants on the streets and the "in your face" begging in so many public places in the city. We hadn't encountered this in other US cities, to this extent. Staff were friendly, especially the concierges. Even got to our first ball game!

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Definitely try to request a room type before you get there, because they're not always guarunteed. Once we got into the room we wanted we LOVED it. The front desk and concierge were extremely helpful. They booked tours for us and helped us find restaurants. They were very accomodating and the room was clean and comfortable... oh and the location is perfect! very close to public transportatation and shopping.

review.title: Average - Great location, bad noise
review.reviewText: - From the Pickwick you can access the cable car lines, the historic tram lines on Market street, the Muni/BART station... very convenient if you are using San Francisco's public transportation. - Walking East of the hotel on Market Street, towards the Embarcadero, is very safe. Walking West of the hotel on Market Street is not very pleasant. - The hotel is very noisy. We had a room on the 5th floor, facing 5th street, which is very noisy. Street noise is actually understandeable - but the elevator noise was horrible. Our room (512) was close to the elevators and the noise from them was really bothering us at night. Bring earplugs!!! - We specifically asked for a non-smoking room. They assigned us a room on a smoking floor. When we asked for a different room, they gave us two options where we could barely fit into, so small the rooms were (on the 2nd floor). We decided to stick with the somoking room and just left the windows opened for the afternoon, which solved the problem. - That said, the room was pretty clean overall. Pleasant, white sheets and comforter. Clean bathroom. Plenty of towels. - The breakfast price was a joke - US$ 12 per person for a "buffet" with about 5 items. Just go to one of the coffee places on Market street.

review.title: Nice, small, in good location for business
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, just two blocks from the convencion Center and one block from Cable cart. It was clean. A bit noisy because back rooms are abpove A/C from other building. Some construction going on, but in general great choice if you are going to the Convencion center, and do not want to pay a lot more for one of the bigger hotels

review.title: Pickwick San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice location and very friendly staff.

review.title: Great Old Building, Wonderful Service
review.reviewText: I found the hotel to be in a great downtown location. A BART ride from the SFO airport, walking distance to some great restuarants,bars etc. Overall the service was fantastic. Rooms small for today's standard - but it is an old building - there is something to be said about the class of history...

review.title: not bad at all
review.reviewText: We stayed there in the beginning of June. It was nice, clean and friendly. Beds were comfortable, and we had a bigger room than expected. Staff was helpfull and helped us with tours. Its very central, good for shopping. Though when you leave and turn left towards museum of modern art MOMA...its sort of dodgy area. have fun

review.title: pickwick hotel
review.reviewText: a decent place to stay. close to all major attractions. service was excellent. rooms are old from the 1930's, but comfortable.

review.title: Pickwick
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and very helpful. Hotel itself is older, but they have made some great updates. Location is close to Market street shopping, and restaurants.

review.title: Nice place for a good price in SF
review.reviewText: Room is comfortable and well appointed. I have stayed there twice and must admit my second stay did not match my first. The internet service in the rooms was out of service and effected my being able to complete my work. Having the computers available in the the business office area helped by I can not access my VPN that way, so it was limited. Even with that though, I would still recommend the Pickwick as it is centrally located and very convenient to public transportation. I will stay there again.

review.title: Perfect For Us!
review.reviewText: My husband and I had visited friends who had a room at the Pickwick a few months ago. The staff didn't seem to mind the very late hour that we got in. And our friend's room was pleasant. We decided to book a room for our "Big Night On The Town" at the Pickwick, because of our limited budget. We LOVED our room! We got in very late, and the staff was very accomodating. Not minding city street noise, we were thrilled with our (window covered walls) corner room over-looking Mission & Fifth. Parking...not a problem, if you know where to look... Close-ish to the Mission and South of Market clubs. The decor seemed to be very new (perhaps recently remodeled?), the tub was big enough for two (okay..no jacuzzi...). We even made alot of late night noise and no one complained! If you are a late night noise maker, ask for a corner room. But, let's keep it a secret!

review.title: Great deal for a convention visit if you're out of pocket
review.reviewText: Needed a non-pricey room near the convention center. This was perfect. Room with a king bed stuffed in it was cozy but complete. Included free HS internet (wired in the room, but I could also receive the Wifi signal from the lobby). Nice little business/computer center where I printed a presentation that I brought in on a thumb drive. Free breakfast (cereal and bagels). Bakery is in same building.

review.title: Old World SF
review.reviewText: The Pickwick is a great bargain for those seeking alternative lodgings to cookie-cutter hotel chains. This recently remodeled establishment captures the mood of an era-gone-by. From the polished marble, hardwoods & brass in the lobby, to the winding staircase (there are elevators, but who can resist!), to the comfy room accomodations, the Pickwick will have you swearing you just spotted Bogie in the lobby. The location is central to the heart of Downtown...a stone's throw to Powell Street, Union Square, Financial District & Moscone Center; just a short walk to many other areas of interest.

review.title: Accomodations OK
review.reviewText:
The hotel was fine. I was given a nice corner room, which unfortunately was on a busy corner (Mission and 5'th) with a fair amount of traffic and construction noise. The noise turned out to not be as bad as I thought it would be as I was not awakened during the night at all.

Their internet access did fail while I was there, but since it was free, I really cannot complain. They provide both wired connections in the room and WIFI in their lounge.

review.title: Scored!
review.reviewText: We totally scored on our whole weekend in the city.  Not only was the weather fantastic, the food terrific and the entertainment exciting our little tucked away hotel was perfect.  Good location, easy to find, helpful staff, extremely comfortable beds, clean bathrooms and all at the right price.  I would definitely stay here again and would definitely recommend it to others (in fact I already have).

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText:
I got what I asked for: a nice room not facing the street, non-smoking, with Internet connection. The windows were not perfect and I was a bit distracted by the noise from the nearby construction site.
The hotel's location and rates are excellent.

review.title: Luxurious and convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel is gorgeous to look at; the rooms are very richly decorated (paintings, red and gold curtains) in classical French style. The buffet breakfast downstairs in the cafe was superb. The concierge could have been a bit more helpful but this did not ruin my stay at the Pickwick. The proximity to the many museums, the Moscone Centre, South of Market and Union Square was very convenient. Great place to stay!

review.title: Small but pleasant--I'll be back!
review.reviewText:
The Pickwick is a cute little hotel that seems to date from the early 1900s although probably isn't quite that old.  Sure, the rooms are a little small, but I'm not coming to San Francisco to stay in my hotel room!  I'll be out at the restaurants and seeing the sights, and just in my hotel to sleep and bathe.  This is the perfect place for that.

Everything was clean and in good working order.  The price was extremely reasonable, much less than similar hotels in the area.  It was a short 5 minute walk to the Metreon, less than 10 mins to the Moscone center.  When I come back for another conference, you can bet I'll be staying here.

review.title: A Place Worth Your Money
review.reviewText: They were very very kind to satisfy our needs. The room is small but clean and has everything you need, especially a very comfortable bed. Complimentary LAN access(10Mbps but it worked fine)in the room and wireless in the hotel lobby. Great location, walking distance to unite squres, close to the ( the cable car)stops up to the Fisherman's warf. The unperfect thing was that the walls of the room are too lack of sound insulation, you would expect quiet neighbours if you want to stay there. In short, it is a good choice that worth the price.

review.title: Nice little hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable but small

review.title: No dresser?!
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was excellent.  Prime location, outstanding staff, charming decor, very convenient high-speed internet and office/exercise facilities.  However, there are certain idiosyncricies associated with a hotel of this age that can't be ignored: climate control is primitive at best, and the rooms are quite small.  As a result, the single closet was VERY small, and apparently, it was decided that the rooms would be too cramped for a dresser!  Still, though, I would likely stay there again, but I would have to investigate other options as well.

review.title: Nice, Cheap room in downtown area!
review.reviewText: Me and a couple of friends decided one day to take a trip to SF at the last minute. We picked the pickwick hotel. A five minute walk from the Bart (subway), minutes away from fishermans wharf, and in the center of downtown SF. The hotel itself was a very nice and quiet. Rooms were a nice size also. Huge over sized beds in every room. Hotel service was excellant as well.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: Not luxurious, but a very good deal. The location is excellent. We didn't demand much from the staff, but they were polite and the room was kept clean. I would stay here again.

review.title: A great find in a great location
review.reviewText: Free high-speed access, rooms are small but cozy.  Beds are very comfortable.  The staff is very accomodating.  Hotel is located across from the 5th/Mission Parking garage or hotel valet parking is available.  1/2 block to Nordstorm's and the San Francisco Shopping Center.  Short walk to Market Street and Union Square.  Cafe in lobby of the hotel is open for breakfast.

review.title: Good Value in Overpriced SF Hotel Market
review.reviewText: The room was clean but small.  The bed was comfortable and large.  I could adjust the temperature in the room.  The room was secure.  Everything in the bathroom worked and was clean.  The staff was friendly.  It looked like it had high speed internet (Cat 5 cable outlet, but did not bring my laptop).  I did not feel unsafe walking around the area at night (the area is experiencing a revival).  If you like to sleep late, construction next door will wake you.  Cable TV was average.  Sound insulation between rooms was minimal.  Two small closets to hang things but no other significant storage.  If you don't mind living out of your suitcase, the place is a good deal compared to some of the other places I've stayed in SF.  I will go back.

review.title: Stayed there at least 20 times
review.reviewText: My teen daughters and I go to San Francisco often.  I prefer this hotel mostly because it is one-half block from the downtown mall (7 stories), 3 blocks from Union Square, 1 block from Cable car, across the street from 5th & Mission parking lot, 1 block from Bart.  The hotel has always been great, it's a small 8-story older hotel (recently renovated) rooms are a little small but we're only in there to sleep after a full day of shopping.

review.title: Excellent hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: The Pickwick is a fantastic hotel with wonderful style and old time feel.  Centralized location makes for a short cab ride to just about every attraction in San Fran.
